Detailed Description

FrequencySystem provides a specific system class for frequency-dependent (linear) systems. Generally two solution flavors are possible:

  • fast solution of moderately-sized systems: For moderate numbers of dof, it is possible to keep frequency-independent matrices in memory. For this, simply provide multiple frequencies prior to ini(). Also provide functions _assemble_fptr and _solve_fptr that should compute the element contributions, and simply add these contributions to give the frequency-dependent overall matrix, respectively. For details see the examples section.
  • solution of large systems: When there is not enough space to keep the frequency-independent contributions in memory, the user need only provide a function _solve_fptr which assembles the overall, frequency-dependent matrix for the current frequency given in the parameter section of EquationSystems<FrequencySystem> named current frequency. For this to work, only provide one frequency.
Author
Daniel Dreyer, 2003

Definition at line 69 of file frequency_system.h.

Definition: system.C:677
SparseMatrix< Number > & libMesh::ImplicitSystem::add_matrix ( const std::string &  mat_name)
inherited

Adds the additional matrix mat_name to this system. Only allowed prior to assemble(). All additional matrices have the same sparsity pattern as the matrix used during solution. When not System but the user wants to initialize the mayor matrix, then all the additional matrices, if existent, have to be initialized by the user, too.

Definition at line 207 of file implicit_system.C.

References libMesh::ImplicitSystem::_can_add_matrices, libMesh::ImplicitSystem::_matrices, libMesh::SparseMatrix< T >::build(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), and libMesh::ImplicitSystem::have_matrix().

Referenced by libMesh::ImplicitSystem::add_system_matrix(), libMesh::EigenTimeSolver::init(), and libMesh::NewmarkSystem::NewmarkSystem().

208 {
209  // only add matrices before initializing...
210  if (!_can_add_matrices)
211  libmesh_error_msg("ERROR: Too late. Cannot add matrices to the system after initialization"
212  << "\n any more. You should have done this earlier.");
213 
214  // Return the matrix if it is already there.
215  if (this->have_matrix(mat_name))
216  return *(_matrices[mat_name]);
217 
218  // Otherwise build the matrix and return it.
219  SparseMatrix<Number>* buf = SparseMatrix<Number>::build(this->comm()).release();
220  _matrices.insert (std::make_pair (mat_name, buf));
221 
222  return *buf;
223 }

1112  // variables of the same FEType and subdomain restriction, catch
1113  // that here and add them as members of the same VariableGroup.
1114  //
1115  // start by setting this flag to whatever the user has requested
1116  // and then consider the conditions which should negate it.
1117  bool should_be_in_vg = this->identify_variable_groups();
1118 
1119  // No variable groups, nothing to add to
1120  if (!this->n_variable_groups())
1121  should_be_in_vg = false;
1122 
1123  else
1124  {
1125  VariableGroup &vg(_variable_groups.back());
1126 
1127  // get a pointer to their subdomain restriction, if any.
1128  const std::set<subdomain_id_type> * const
1129  their_active_subdomains (vg.implicitly_active() ?
1130  NULL : &vg.active_subdomains());
1131 
1132  // Different types?
1133  if (vg.type() != type)
1134  should_be_in_vg = false;
1135 
1136  // they are restricted, we aren't?
1137  if (their_active_subdomains && !active_subdomains)
1138  should_be_in_vg = false;
1139 
1140  // they aren't restriced, we are?
1141  if (!their_active_subdomains && active_subdomains)
1142  should_be_in_vg = false;
1143 
1144  if (their_active_subdomains && active_subdomains)
1145  // restricted to different sets?
1146  if (*their_active_subdomains != *active_subdomains)
1147  should_be_in_vg = false;
1148 
1149  // OK, after all that, append the variable to the vg if none of the conditions
1150  // were violated
1151  if (should_be_in_vg)
1152  {
1153  const unsigned short curr_n_vars = cast_int<unsigned short>
1154  (this->n_vars());
1155 
1156  vg.append (var);
1157 
1158  _variables.push_back(vg(vg.n_variables()-1));
1159  _variable_numbers[var] = curr_n_vars;
1160  return curr_n_vars;
1161  }
1162  }
1163 
1164  // otherwise, fall back to adding a single variable group
1165  return this->add_variables (std::vector<std::string>(1, var),
1166  type,
1167  active_subdomains);
1168 }

NumericVector< Number > & libMesh::System::add_vector ( const std::string &  vec_name,
const bool  projections = true,
const ParallelType  type = PARALLEL 
)
inherited

Adds the additional vector vec_name to this system. All the additional vectors are similarly distributed, like the solution, and inititialized to zero.

By default vectors added by add_vector are projected to changed grids by reinit(). To zero them instead (more efficient), pass "false" as the second argument

Definition at line 677 of file system.C.

libMesh::System::add_vector

Definition: system.C:677
void libMesh::ImplicitSystem::adjoint_qoi_parameter_sensitivity ( const QoISet &  qoi_indices,
const ParameterVector &  parameters,
SensitivityData &  sensitivities 
)
virtualinherited

Solves for the derivative of each of the system's quantities of interest q in qoi[qoi_indices] with respect to each parameter in parameters, placing the result for qoi i and parameter j into sensitivities[i][j].

Uses adjoint_solve() and the adjoint sensitivity method.

Currently uses finite differenced derivatives (partial q / partial p) and (partial R / partial p).

Reimplemented from libMesh::System.

Definition at line 684 of file implicit_system.C.

References libMesh::SensitivityData::allocate_data(), libMesh::AutoPtr< Tp >::get(), libMesh::get_dof_map(), libMesh::QoISet::has_index(), libMesh::Real, libMesh::ParameterVector::size(), and libMesh::TOLERANCE.

687 {
688  const unsigned int Np = cast_int<unsigned int>
689  (parameters.size());
690  const unsigned int Nq = cast_int<unsigned int>
691  (qoi.size());
692 
693  // We currently get partial derivatives via central differencing
694  const Real delta_p = TOLERANCE;
695 
696  // An introduction to the problem:
697  //
698  // Residual R(u(p),p) = 0
699  // partial R / partial u = J = system matrix
700  //
701  // This implies that:
702  // d/dp(R) = 0
703  // (partial R / partial p) +
704  // (partial R / partial u) * (partial u / partial p) = 0
705 
706  // We first do an adjoint solve:
707  // J^T * z = (partial q / partial u)
708  // if we havent already or dont have an initial condition for the adjoint
709  if (!this->is_adjoint_already_solved())
710  {
711  this->adjoint_solve(qoi_indices);
712  }
713 
714  // Get ready to fill in senstivities:
715  sensitivities.allocate_data(qoi_indices, *this, parameters);
716 
717  // We use the identities:
718  // dq/dp = (partial q / partial p) + (partial q / partial u) *
719  // (partial u / partial p)
720  // dq/dp = (partial q / partial p) + (J^T * z) *
721  // (partial u / partial p)
722  // dq/dp = (partial q / partial p) + z * J *
723  // (partial u / partial p)
724 
725  // Leading to our final formula:
726  // dq/dp = (partial q / partial p) - z * (partial R / partial p)
727 
728  // In the case of adjoints with heterogenous Dirichlet boundary
729  // function phi, where
730  // q := R(u,phi) + S(u)
731  // the final formula works out to:
732  // dq/dp = (partial S / partial p) - z * (partial R / partial p)
733  // Because we currently have no direct access to
734  // (partial S / partial p), we use the identity
735  // (partial S / partial p) = (partial q / partial p) -
736  // phi * (partial R / partial p)
737  // to derive an equivalent equation:
738  // dq/dp = (partial q / partial p) - (z+phi) * (partial R / partial p)
739 
740  for (unsigned int j=0; j != Np; ++j)
741  {
742  // (partial q / partial p) ~= (q(p+dp)-q(p-dp))/(2*dp)
743  // (partial R / partial p) ~= (rhs(p+dp) - rhs(p-dp))/(2*dp)
744 
745  Number old_parameter = *parameters[j];
746  // Number old_qoi = this->qoi;
747 
748  *parameters[j] = old_parameter - delta_p;
749  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
750  std::vector<Number> qoi_minus = this->qoi;
751 
752  this->assembly(true, false);
753  this->rhs->close();
754 
755  // FIXME - this can and should be optimized to avoid the clone()
756  AutoPtr<NumericVector<Number> > partialR_partialp = this->rhs->clone();
757  *partialR_partialp *= -1;
758 
759  *parameters[j] = old_parameter + delta_p;
760  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
761  std::vector<Number>& qoi_plus = this->qoi;
762 
763  std::vector<Number> partialq_partialp(Nq, 0);
764  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
765  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
766  partialq_partialp[i] = (qoi_plus[i] - qoi_minus[i]) / (2.*delta_p);
767 
768  this->assembly(true, false);
769  this->rhs->close();
770  *partialR_partialp += *this->rhs;
771  *partialR_partialp /= (2.*delta_p);
772 
773  // Don't leave the parameter changed
774  *parameters[j] = old_parameter;
775 
776  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
777  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
778  {
779 
780  if (this->get_dof_map().has_adjoint_dirichlet_boundaries(i))
781  {
782  AutoPtr<NumericVector<Number> > lift_func =
783  this->get_adjoint_solution(i).zero_clone();
784  this->get_dof_map().enforce_constraints_exactly
785  (*this, lift_func.get(),
786  /* homogeneous = */ false);
787  sensitivities[i][j] = partialq_partialp[i] -
788  partialR_partialp->dot(*lift_func) -
789  partialR_partialp->dot(this->get_adjoint_solution(i));
790  }
791  else
792  sensitivities[i][j] = partialq_partialp[i] -
793  partialR_partialp->dot(this->get_adjoint_solution(i));
794  }
795  }
796 
797  // All parameters have been reset.
798  // We didn't cache the original rhs or matrix for memory reasons,
799  // but we can restore them to a state consistent solution -
800  // principle of least surprise.
801  this->assembly(true, true);
802  this->rhs->close();
803  this->matrix->close();
804  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
805 }
libMesh::NumericVector::zero_clone
virtual AutoPtr< NumericVector< T > > zero_clone() const =0
libMesh::NumericVector::clone
virtual AutoPtr< NumericVector< T > > clone() const =0
libMesh::ExplicitSystem::rhs
NumericVector< Number > * rhs
Definition: explicit_system.h:122
libMesh::TOLERANCE
static const Real TOLERANCE
Definition: libmesh_common.h:127
libMesh::DofMap::has_adjoint_dirichlet_boundaries
bool has_adjoint_dirichlet_boundaries(unsigned int q) const
Definition: dof_map_constraints.C:3782
libMesh::System::get_dof_map
const DofMap & get_dof_map() const
Definition: system.h:1956
libMesh::System::qoi
std::vector< Number > qoi
Definition: system.h:1527
libMesh::ImplicitSystem::adjoint_solve
virtual std::pair< unsigned int, Real > adjoint_solve(const QoISet &qoi_indices=QoISet())
Definition: implicit_system.C:365
libMesh::ExplicitSystem::assemble_qoi
virtual void assemble_qoi(const QoISet &qoi_indices=QoISet())
Definition: explicit_system.C:89
libMesh::SparseMatrix::close
virtual void close() const =0
libMesh::System::is_adjoint_already_solved
bool is_adjoint_already_solved() const
Definition: system.h:361
libMesh::NumericVector::close
virtual void close()=0
libMesh::Real
DIE A HORRIBLE DEATH HERE typedef LIBMESH_DEFAULT_SCALAR_TYPE Real
Definition: libmesh_common.h:119
libMesh::ImplicitSystem::matrix
SparseMatrix< Number > * matrix
Definition: implicit_system.h:335
libMesh::System::get_adjoint_solution
NumericVector< Number > & get_adjoint_solution(unsigned int i=0)
Definition: system.C:984
libMesh::Number
Real Number
Definition: libmesh_common.h:172
libMesh::ImplicitSystem::assembly

Definition: dof_map_constraints.C:1895
std::pair< unsigned int, Real > libMesh::ImplicitSystem::adjoint_solve ( const QoISet &  qoi_indices = QoISet())
virtualinherited

Assembles & solves the linear system (dR/du)^T*z = dq/du, for those quantities of interest q specified by qoi_indices.

Leave qoi_indices empty to solve all adjoint problems.

Returns a pair with the total number of linear iterations performed and the (sum of the) final residual norms

Reimplemented from libMesh::System.

Reimplemented in libMesh::DifferentiableSystem.

Definition at line 365 of file implicit_system.C.

References libMesh::System::add_adjoint_solution(), libMesh::LinearSolver< T >::adjoint_solve(), libMesh::System::assemble_before_solve, libMesh::ExplicitSystem::assemble_qoi_derivative(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::assembly(), libMesh::DofMap::enforce_adjoint_constraints_exactly(), libMesh::System::get_adjoint_rhs(), libMesh::System::get_adjoint_solution(), libMesh::System::get_dof_map(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::get_linear_solve_parameters(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::get_linear_solver(), libMesh::QoISet::has_index(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::matrix, libMesh::System::qoi, libMesh::ImplicitSystem::release_linear_solver(), libMesh::START_LOG(), and libMesh::STOP_LOG().

Referenced by libMesh::DifferentiableSystem::adjoint_solve().

366 {
367  // Log how long the linear solve takes.
368  START_LOG("adjoint_solve()", "ImplicitSystem");
369 
370  if (this->assemble_before_solve)
371  // Assemble the linear system
372  this->assembly (/* get_residual = */ false,
373  /* get_jacobian = */ true);
374 
375  // The adjoint problem is linear
376  LinearSolver<Number> *linear_solver = this->get_linear_solver();
377 
378  // Reset and build the RHS from the QOI derivative
379  this->assemble_qoi_derivative(qoi_indices);
380 
381  // Our iteration counts and residuals will be sums of the individual
382  // results
383  std::pair<unsigned int, Real> solver_params =
384  this->get_linear_solve_parameters();
385  std::pair<unsigned int, Real> totalrval = std::make_pair(0,0.0);
386 
387  for (unsigned int i=0; i != this->qoi.size(); ++i)
388  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
389  {
390  const std::pair<unsigned int, Real> rval =
391  linear_solver->adjoint_solve (*matrix, this->add_adjoint_solution(i),
392  this->get_adjoint_rhs(i),
393  solver_params.second,
394  solver_params.first);
395 
396  totalrval.first += rval.first;
397  totalrval.second += rval.second;
398  }
399 
400  this->release_linear_solver(linear_solver);
401 
402  // The linear solver may not have fit our constraints exactly
403 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_CONSTRAINTS
404  for (unsigned int i=0; i != this->qoi.size(); ++i)
405  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
406  this->get_dof_map().enforce_adjoint_constraints_exactly
407  (this->get_adjoint_solution(i), i);
408 #endif
409 
410  // Stop logging the nonlinear solve
411  STOP_LOG("adjoint_solve()", "ImplicitSystem");
412 
413  return totalrval;
414 }

void libMesh::ImplicitSystem::assemble_residual_derivatives ( const ParameterVector &  parameters)
virtualinherited

Residual parameter derivative function.

Uses finite differences by default.

This will assemble the sensitivity rhs vectors to hold -(partial R / partial p_i), making them ready to solve the forward sensitivity equation.

Can be overloaded in derived classes.

Reimplemented from libMesh::System.

Definition at line 648 of file implicit_system.C.

References libMesh::System::add_sensitivity_rhs(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::assembly(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::close(), libMesh::Real, libMesh::ExplicitSystem::rhs, libMesh::ParameterVector::size(), and libMesh::TOLERANCE.

Referenced by libMesh::ImplicitSystem::sensitivity_solve().

649 {
650  const unsigned int Np = cast_int<unsigned int>
651  (parameters.size());
652  Real deltap = TOLERANCE;
653 
654  for (unsigned int p=0; p != Np; ++p)
655  {
656  NumericVector<Number> &sensitivity_rhs = this->add_sensitivity_rhs(p);
657 
658  // Approximate -(partial R / partial p) by
659  // (R(p-dp) - R(p+dp)) / (2*dp)
660 
661  Number old_parameter = *parameters[p];
662  *parameters[p] -= deltap;
663 
664  this->assembly(true, false);
665  this->rhs->close();
666  sensitivity_rhs = *this->rhs;
667 
668  *parameters[p] = old_parameter + deltap;
669 
670  this->assembly(true, false);
671  this->rhs->close();
672 
673  sensitivity_rhs -= *this->rhs;
674  sensitivity_rhs /= (2*deltap);
675  sensitivity_rhs.close();
676 
677  *parameters[p] = old_parameter;
678  }
679 }

libMesh::out

Definition: libmesh_common.h:222
void libMesh::LinearImplicitSystem::attach_shell_matrix ( ShellMatrix< Number > *  shell_matrix)
inherited

This function enables the user to provide a shell matrix, i.e. a matrix that is not stored element-wise, but as a function. When you register your shell matrix using this function, calling solve() will no longer use the matrix member but the registered shell matrix instead. You can reset this behaviour to its original state by supplying a NULL pointer to this function.

Definition at line 171 of file linear_implicit_system.C.

References libMesh::LinearImplicitSystem::_shell_matrix.

Referenced by libMesh::LinearImplicitSystem::detach_shell_matrix().

172 {
173  _shell_matrix = shell_matrix;
174 }
libMesh::LinearImplicitSystem::_shell_matrix

Definition: linear_implicit_system.h:200
void libMesh::FrequencySystem::attach_solve_function ( void   fptrEquationSystems &es,const std::string &name)

Register a required user function to use in assembling/solving the system. It is intended to compute frequency-dependent data. For proper work of FrequencySystem, at least this function has to be provided by the user.

libMesh::libmesh_assert

libMesh::FrequencySystem::solve_system
void(* solve_system)(EquationSystems &es, const std::string &name)
Definition: frequency_system.h:191
void libMesh::System::boundary_project_solution ( const std::set< boundary_id_type > &  b,
const std::vector< unsigned int > &  variables,
FunctionBase< Number > *  f,
FunctionBase< Gradient > *  g = NULL 
)
inherited

Projects arbitrary boundary functions onto a vector of degree of freedom values for the current system. Only degrees of freedom which affect the function's trace on a boundary in the set b are affected. Only degrees of freedom associated with the variables listed in the vector variables are projected. The function value f and its gradient g are user-provided cloneable functors. A gradient g is only required/used for projecting onto finite element spaces with continuous derivatives. If non-default Parameters are to be used, they can be provided in the parameters argument.

This method projects an arbitary boundary function onto the solution via L2 projections and nodal interpolations on each element.

Definition at line 678 of file system_projection.C.

682 {
683  this->boundary_project_vector(b, variables, *solution, f, g);
684 
685  solution->localize(*current_local_solution);
686 }

libMesh::System::boundary_project_vector
void boundary_project_vector(const std::set< boundary_id_type > &b, const std::vector< unsigned int > &variables, NumericVector< Number > &new_vector, FunctionBase< Number > *f, FunctionBase< Gradient > *g=NULL, int is_adjoint=-1) const
Definition: system_projection.C:722
void libMesh::System::boundary_project_solution ( const std::set< boundary_id_type > &  b,
const std::vector< unsigned int > &  variables,
Number   fptrconst Point &p,const Parameters &parameters,const std::string &sys_name,const std::string &unknown_name,
Gradient   gptrconst Point &p,const Parameters &parameters,const std::string &sys_name,const std::string &unknown_name,
const Parameters &  parameters 
)
inherited

Projects arbitrary boundary functions onto a vector of degree of freedom values for the current system. Only degrees of freedom which affect the function's trace on a boundary in the set b are affected. Only degrees of freedom associated with the variables listed in the vector variables are projected. The function value fptr and its gradient gptr are represented by function pointers. A gradient gptr is only required/used for projecting onto finite element spaces with continuous derivatives.

This method projects components of an arbitrary boundary function onto the solution via L2 projections and nodal interpolations on each element.

libMesh::System::boundary_project_solution
void boundary_project_solution(const std::set< boundary_id_type > &b, const std::vector< unsigned int > &variables, FunctionBase< Number > *f, FunctionBase< Gradient > *g=NULL)
Definition: system_projection.C:678
void libMesh::System::boundary_project_vector ( const std::set< boundary_id_type > &  b,
const std::vector< unsigned int > &  variables,
NumericVector< Number > &  new_vector,
FunctionBase< Number > *  f,
FunctionBase< Gradient > *  g = NULL,
int  is_adjoint = -1 
) const
inherited

Projects arbitrary boundary functions onto a vector of degree of freedom values for the current system. Only degrees of freedom which affect the function's trace on a boundary in the set b are affected. Only degrees of freedom associated with the variables listed in the vector variables are projected. The function value f and its gradient g are user-provided cloneable functors. A gradient g is only required/used for projecting onto finite element spaces with continuous derivatives. If non-default Parameters are to be used, they can be provided in the parameters argument.

Constrain the new vector using the requested adjoint rather than primal constraints if is_adjoint is non-negative.

This method projects an arbitrary function via L2 projections and nodal interpolations on each element.

Definition at line 722 of file system_projection.C.

References libMesh::NumericVector< T >::close(), libMesh::get_dof_map(), libMesh::Threads::parallel_for(), libMesh::START_LOG(), and libMesh::STOP_LOG().

728 {
729  START_LOG ("boundary_project_vector()", "System");
730 
731  Threads::parallel_for
732  (ConstElemRange (this->get_mesh().active_local_elements_begin(),
733  this->get_mesh().active_local_elements_end() ),
734  BoundaryProjectSolution(b, variables, *this, f, g,
735  this->get_equation_systems().parameters,
736  new_vector)
737  );
738 
739  // We don't do SCALAR dofs when just projecting the boundary, so
740  // we're done here.
741 
742  new_vector.close();
743 
744 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_CONSTRAINTS
745  if (is_adjoint == -1)
746  this->get_dof_map().enforce_constraints_exactly(*this, &new_vector);
747  else if (is_adjoint >= 0)
748  this->get_dof_map().enforce_adjoint_constraints_exactly(new_vector,
749  is_adjoint);
750 #endif
751 
752  STOP_LOG("boundary_project_vector()", "System");
753 }

inherited

Projects arbitrary boundary functions onto a vector of degree of freedom values for the current system. Only degrees of freedom which affect the function's trace on a boundary in the set b are affected. Only degrees of freedom associated with the variables listed in the vector variables are projected. The function value fptr and its gradient gptr are represented by function pointers. A gradient gptr is only required/used for projecting onto finite element spaces with continuous derivatives.

Constrain the new vector using the requested adjoint rather than primal constraints if is_adjoint is non-negative.

This method projects an arbitrary boundary function via L2 projections and nodal interpolations on each element.

Definition at line 1410 of file system.C.

References libMesh::System::_dof_map, std::abs(), libMesh::MeshBase::active_local_elements_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::active_local_elements_end(), libMesh::TypeVector< T >::add_scaled(), libMesh::TypeTensor< T >::add_scaled(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::build(), libMesh::FEGenericBase< T >::build(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::FEType::default_quadrature_rule(), libMesh::dim, libMesh::DISCRETE_L1, libMesh::DISCRETE_L2, libMesh::DISCRETE_L_INF, libMesh::System::discrete_var_norm(), libMesh::DofMap::dof_indices(), libMesh::AutoPtr< Tp >::get(), libMesh::System::get_dof_map(), libMesh::System::get_mesh(), libMesh::H1, libMesh::H1_SEMINORM, libMesh::H2, libMesh::H2_SEMINORM, libMesh::SystemNorm::is_discrete(), libMesh::L1, libMesh::NumericVector< T >::l1_norm(), libMesh::L2, libMesh::NumericVector< T >::l2_norm(), libMesh::L_INF, libMesh::NumericVector< T >::linfty_norm(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::localize(), std::max(), libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::max(), libMesh::MeshBase::mesh_dimension(), libMesh::System::n_vars(), libMesh::TensorTools::norm_sq(), libMesh::Real, libMesh::SERIAL, libMesh::TypeVector< T >::size(), libMesh::TypeTensor< T >::size(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::size(), libMesh::TypeVector< T >::size_sq(), libMesh::TypeTensor< T >::size_sq(), libMesh::START_LOG(), libMesh::STOP_LOG(), libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::sum(), libMesh::SystemNorm::type(), libMesh::DofMap::variable_type(), libMesh::W1_INF_SEMINORM, libMesh::W2_INF_SEMINORM, libMesh::SystemNorm::weight(), and libMesh::SystemNorm::weight_sq().

1412 {
1413  // This function must be run on all processors at once
1414  parallel_object_only();
1415 
1416  START_LOG ("calculate_norm()", "System");
1417 
1418  // Zero the norm before summation
1419  Real v_norm = 0.;
1420 
1421  if (norm.is_discrete())
1422  {
1423  STOP_LOG ("calculate_norm()", "System");
1424  //Check to see if all weights are 1.0 and all types are equal
1425  FEMNormType norm_type0 = norm.type(0);
1426  unsigned int check_var = 0;
1427  for (; check_var != this->n_vars(); ++check_var)
1428  if((norm.weight(check_var) != 1.0) || (norm.type(check_var) != norm_type0))
1429  break;
1430 
1431  //All weights were 1.0 so just do the full vector discrete norm
1432  if(check_var == this->n_vars())
1433  {
1434  if(norm_type0 == DISCRETE_L1)
1435  return v.l1_norm();
1436  if(norm_type0 == DISCRETE_L2)
1437  return v.l2_norm();
1438  if(norm_type0 == DISCRETE_L_INF)
1439  return v.linfty_norm();
1440  else
1441  libmesh_error_msg("Invalid norm_type0 = " << norm_type0);
1442  }
1443 
1444  for (unsigned int var=0; var != this->n_vars(); ++var)
1445  {
1446  // Skip any variables we don't need to integrate
1447  if (norm.weight(var) == 0.0)
1448  continue;
1449 
1450  v_norm += norm.weight(var) * discrete_var_norm(v, var, norm.type(var));
1451  }
1452 
1453  return v_norm;
1454  }
1455 
1456  // Localize the potentially parallel vector
1457  AutoPtr<NumericVector<Number> > local_v = NumericVector<Number>::build(this->comm());
1458  local_v->init(v.size(), true, SERIAL);
1459  v.localize (*local_v, _dof_map->get_send_list());
1460 
1461  unsigned int dim = this->get_mesh().mesh_dimension();
1462 
1463  // I'm not sure how best to mix Hilbert norms on some variables (for
1464  // which we'll want to square then sum then square root) with norms
1465  // like L_inf (for which we'll just want to take an absolute value
1466  // and then sum).
1467  bool using_hilbert_norm = true,
1468  using_nonhilbert_norm = true;
1469 
1470  // Loop over all variables
1471  for (unsigned int var=0; var != this->n_vars(); ++var)
1472  {
1473  // Skip any variables we don't need to integrate
1474  Real norm_weight_sq = norm.weight_sq(var);
1475  if (norm_weight_sq == 0.0)
1476  continue;
1477  Real norm_weight = norm.weight(var);
1478 
1479  // Check for unimplemented norms (rather than just returning 0).
1480  FEMNormType norm_type = norm.type(var);
1481  if((norm_type==H1) ||
1482  (norm_type==H2) ||
1483  (norm_type==L2) ||
1484  (norm_type==H1_SEMINORM) ||
1485  (norm_type==H2_SEMINORM))
1486  {
1487  if (!using_hilbert_norm)
1488  libmesh_not_implemented();
1489  using_nonhilbert_norm = false;
1490  }
1491  else if ((norm_type==L1) ||
1492  (norm_type==L_INF) ||
1493  (norm_type==W1_INF_SEMINORM) ||
1494  (norm_type==W2_INF_SEMINORM))
1495  {
1496  if (!using_nonhilbert_norm)
1497  libmesh_not_implemented();
1498  using_hilbert_norm = false;
1499  }
1500  else
1501  libmesh_not_implemented();
1502 
1503  const FEType& fe_type = this->get_dof_map().variable_type(var);
1504  AutoPtr<QBase> qrule =
1505  fe_type.default_quadrature_rule (dim);
1506  AutoPtr<FEBase> fe
1507  (FEBase::build(dim, fe_type));
1508  fe->attach_quadrature_rule (qrule.get());
1509 
1510  const std::vector<Real>& JxW = fe->get_JxW();
1511  const std::vector<std::vector<Real> >* phi = NULL;
1512  if (norm_type == H1 ||
1513  norm_type == H2 ||
1514  norm_type == L2 ||
1515  norm_type == L1 ||
1516  norm_type == L_INF)
1517  phi = &(fe->get_phi());
1518 
1519  const std::vector<std::vector<RealGradient> >* dphi = NULL;
1520  if (norm_type == H1 ||
1521  norm_type == H2 ||
1522  norm_type == H1_SEMINORM ||
1523  norm_type == W1_INF_SEMINORM)
1524  dphi = &(fe->get_dphi());
1525 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_SECOND_DERIVATIVES
1526  const std::vector<std::vector<RealTensor> >* d2phi = NULL;
1527  if (norm_type == H2 ||
1528  norm_type == H2_SEMINORM ||
1529  norm_type == W2_INF_SEMINORM)
1530  d2phi = &(fe->get_d2phi());
1531 #endif
1532 
1533  std::vector<dof_id_type> dof_indices;
1534 
1535  // Begin the loop over the elements
1536  MeshBase::const_element_iterator el =
1537  this->get_mesh().active_local_elements_begin();
1538  const MeshBase::const_element_iterator end_el =
1539  this->get_mesh().active_local_elements_end();
1540 
1541  for ( ; el != end_el; ++el)
1542  {
1543  const Elem* elem = *el;
1544 
1545  fe->reinit (elem);
1546 
1547  this->get_dof_map().dof_indices (elem, dof_indices, var);
1548 
1549  const unsigned int n_qp = qrule->n_points();
1550 
1551  const unsigned int n_sf = cast_int<unsigned int>
1552  (dof_indices.size());
1553 
1554  // Begin the loop over the Quadrature points.
1555  for (unsigned int qp=0; qp<n_qp; qp++)
1556  {
1557  if (norm_type == L1)
1558  {
1559  Number u_h = 0.;
1560  for (unsigned int i=0; i != n_sf; ++i)
1561  u_h += (*phi)[i][qp] * (*local_v)(dof_indices[i]);
1562  v_norm += norm_weight *
1563  JxW[qp] * std::abs(u_h);
1564  }
1565 
1566  if (norm_type == L_INF)
1567  {
1568  Number u_h = 0.;
1569  for (unsigned int i=0; i != n_sf; ++i)
1570  u_h += (*phi)[i][qp] * (*local_v)(dof_indices[i]);
1571  v_norm = std::max(v_norm, norm_weight * std::abs(u_h));
1572  }
1573 
1574  if (norm_type == H1 ||
1575  norm_type == H2 ||
1576  norm_type == L2)
1577  {
1578  Number u_h = 0.;
1579  for (unsigned int i=0; i != n_sf; ++i)
1580  u_h += (*phi)[i][qp] * (*local_v)(dof_indices[i]);
1581  v_norm += norm_weight_sq *
1582  JxW[qp] * TensorTools::norm_sq(u_h);
1583  }
1584 
1585  if (norm_type == H1 ||
1586  norm_type == H2 ||
1587  norm_type == H1_SEMINORM)
1588  {
1589  Gradient grad_u_h;
1590  for (unsigned int i=0; i != n_sf; ++i)
1591  grad_u_h.add_scaled((*dphi)[i][qp], (*local_v)(dof_indices[i]));
1592  v_norm += norm_weight_sq *
1593  JxW[qp] * grad_u_h.size_sq();
1594  }
1595 
1596  if (norm_type == W1_INF_SEMINORM)
1597  {
1598  Gradient grad_u_h;
1599  for (unsigned int i=0; i != n_sf; ++i)
1600  grad_u_h.add_scaled((*dphi)[i][qp], (*local_v)(dof_indices[i]));
1601  v_norm = std::max(v_norm, norm_weight * grad_u_h.size());
1602  }
1603 
1604 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_SECOND_DERIVATIVES
1605  if (norm_type == H2 ||
1606  norm_type == H2_SEMINORM)
1607  {
1608  Tensor hess_u_h;
1609  for (unsigned int i=0; i != n_sf; ++i)
1610  hess_u_h.add_scaled((*d2phi)[i][qp], (*local_v)(dof_indices[i]));
1611  v_norm += norm_weight_sq *
1612  JxW[qp] * hess_u_h.size_sq();
1613  }
1614 
1615  if (norm_type == W2_INF_SEMINORM)
1616  {
1617  Tensor hess_u_h;
1618  for (unsigned int i=0; i != n_sf; ++i)
1619  hess_u_h.add_scaled((*d2phi)[i][qp], (*local_v)(dof_indices[i]));
1620  v_norm = std::max(v_norm, norm_weight * hess_u_h.size());
1621  }
1622 #endif
1623  }
1624  }
1625  }
1626 
1627  if (using_hilbert_norm)
1628  {
1629  this->comm().sum(v_norm);
1630  v_norm = std::sqrt(v_norm);
1631  }
1632  else
1633  {
1634  this->comm().max(v_norm);
1635  }
1636 
1637  STOP_LOG ("calculate_norm()", "System");
1638 
1639  return v_norm;
1640 }

void libMesh::FrequencySystem::clear ( )
virtual

Clear all the data structures associated with the system, but leave the frequencies untouched. The frequencies belong to the EquationSystems object.

Reimplemented from libMesh::LinearImplicitSystem.

Definition at line 73 of file frequency_system.C.

78  _keep_solution_duplicates = true;
79  _finished_init = false;
80  _finished_assemble = false;
81 
82  /*
83  * We have to distinguish between the
84  * simple straightforward "clear()"
85  * and the clear that also touches the
86  * EquationSystems parameters "current frequency" etc.
87  * Namely, when reading from file (through equation_systems_io.C
88  * methods), the param's are read in, then the systems.
89  * Prior to reading a system, this system gets cleared...
90  * And there, all the previously loaded frequency parameters
91  * would get lost...
92  */
93 }

bool libMesh::System::compare ( const System &  other_system,
const Real  threshold,
const bool  verbose 
) const
virtualinherited
Returns
true when the other system contains identical data, up to the given threshold. Outputs some diagnostic info when verbose is set.

Definition at line 527 of file system.C.

References libMesh::System::_can_add_vectors, libMesh::System::_sys_name, libMesh::System::_vectors, libMesh::System::get_vector(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::System::n_vectors(), libMesh::System::name(), libMesh::out, and libMesh::System::solution.

Referenced by libMesh::EquationSystems::compare().

530 {
531  // we do not care for matrices, but for vectors
532  libmesh_assert (!_can_add_vectors);
533  libmesh_assert (!other_system._can_add_vectors);
534 
535  if (verbose)
536  {
537  libMesh::out << " Systems \"" << _sys_name << "\"" << std::endl;
538  libMesh::out << " comparing matrices not supported." << std::endl;
539  libMesh::out << " comparing names...";
540  }
541 
542  // compare the name: 0 means identical
543  const int name_result = _sys_name.compare(other_system.name());
544  if (verbose)
545  {
546  if (name_result == 0)
547  libMesh::out << " identical." << std::endl;
548  else
549  libMesh::out << " names not identical." << std::endl;
550  libMesh::out << " comparing solution vector...";
551  }
552 
553 
554  // compare the solution: -1 means identical
555  const int solu_result = solution->compare (*other_system.solution.get(),
556  threshold);
557 
558  if (verbose)
559  {
560  if (solu_result == -1)
561  libMesh::out << " identical up to threshold." << std::endl;
562  else
563  libMesh::out << " first difference occured at index = "
564  << solu_result << "." << std::endl;
565  }
566 
567 
568  // safety check, whether we handle at least the same number
569  // of vectors
570  std::vector<int> ov_result;
571 
572  if (this->n_vectors() != other_system.n_vectors())
573  {
574  if (verbose)
575  {
576  libMesh::out << " Fatal difference. This system handles "
577  << this->n_vectors() << " add'l vectors," << std::endl
578  << " while the other system handles "
579  << other_system.n_vectors()
580  << " add'l vectors." << std::endl
581  << " Aborting comparison." << std::endl;
582  }
583  return false;
584  }
585  else if (this->n_vectors() == 0)
586  {
587  // there are no additional vectors...
588  ov_result.clear ();
589  }
590  else
591  {
592  // compare other vectors
593  for (const_vectors_iterator pos = _vectors.begin();
594  pos != _vectors.end(); ++pos)
595  {
596  if (verbose)
597  libMesh::out << " comparing vector \""
598  << pos->first << "\" ...";
599 
600  // assume they have the same name
601  const NumericVector<Number>& other_system_vector =
602  other_system.get_vector(pos->first);
603 
604  ov_result.push_back(pos->second->compare (other_system_vector,
605  threshold));
606 
607  if (verbose)
608  {
609  if (ov_result[ov_result.size()-1] == -1)
610  libMesh::out << " identical up to threshold." << std::endl;
611  else
612  libMesh::out << " first difference occured at" << std::endl
613  << " index = " << ov_result[ov_result.size()-1] << "." << std::endl;
614  }
615 
616  }
617 
618  } // finished comparing additional vectors
619 
620 
621  bool overall_result;
622 
623  // sum up the results
624  if ((name_result==0) && (solu_result==-1))
625  {
626  if (ov_result.size()==0)
627  overall_result = true;
628  else
629  {
630  bool ov_identical;
631  unsigned int n = 0;
632  do
633  {
634  ov_identical = (ov_result[n]==-1);
635  n++;
636  }
637  while (ov_identical && n<ov_result.size());
638  overall_result = ov_identical;
639  }
640  }
641  else
642  overall_result = false;
643 
644  if (verbose)
645  {
646  libMesh::out << " finished comparisons, ";
647  if (overall_result)
648  libMesh::out << "found no differences." << std::endl << std::endl;
649  else
650  libMesh::out << "found differences." << std::endl << std::endl;
651  }
652 
653  return overall_result;
654 }

void libMesh::ImplicitSystem::forward_qoi_parameter_sensitivity ( const QoISet &  qoi_indices,
const ParameterVector &  parameters,
SensitivityData &  sensitivities 
)
virtualinherited

Solves for the derivative of each of the system's quantities of interest q in qoi[qoi_indices] with respect to each parameter in parameters, placing the result for qoi i and parameter j into sensitivities[i][j].

Uses the forward sensitivity method.

Currently uses finite differenced derivatives (partial q / partial p) and (partial R / partial p).

Reimplemented from libMesh::System.

Definition at line 810 of file implicit_system.C.

References libMesh::SensitivityData::allocate_data(), libMesh::QoISet::has_index(), libMesh::Real, libMesh::ParameterVector::size(), and libMesh::TOLERANCE.

813 {
814  const unsigned int Np = cast_int<unsigned int>
815  (parameters.size());
816  const unsigned int Nq = cast_int<unsigned int>
817  (qoi.size());
818 
819  // We currently get partial derivatives via central differencing
820  const Real delta_p = TOLERANCE;
821 
822  // An introduction to the problem:
823  //
824  // Residual R(u(p),p) = 0
825  // partial R / partial u = J = system matrix
826  //
827  // This implies that:
828  // d/dp(R) = 0
829  // (partial R / partial p) +
830  // (partial R / partial u) * (partial u / partial p) = 0
831 
832  // We first solve for (partial u / partial p) for each parameter:
833  // J * (partial u / partial p) = - (partial R / partial p)
834 
835  this->sensitivity_solve(parameters);
836 
837  // Get ready to fill in senstivities:
838  sensitivities.allocate_data(qoi_indices, *this, parameters);
839 
840  // We use the identity:
841  // dq/dp = (partial q / partial p) + (partial q / partial u) *
842  // (partial u / partial p)
843 
844  // We get (partial q / partial u) from the user
845  this->assemble_qoi_derivative(qoi_indices);
846 
847  // FIXME: what do we do with adjoint boundary conditions here?
848 
849  // We don't need these to be closed() in this function, but libMesh
850  // standard practice is to have them closed() by the time the
851  // function exits
852  for (unsigned int i=0; i != this->qoi.size(); ++i)
853  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
854  this->get_adjoint_rhs(i).close();
855 
856  for (unsigned int j=0; j != Np; ++j)
857  {
858  // (partial q / partial p) ~= (q(p+dp)-q(p-dp))/(2*dp)
859 
860  Number old_parameter = *parameters[j];
861 
862  *parameters[j] = old_parameter - delta_p;
863  this->assemble_qoi();
864  std::vector<Number> qoi_minus = this->qoi;
865 
866  *parameters[j] = old_parameter + delta_p;
867  this->assemble_qoi();
868  std::vector<Number>& qoi_plus = this->qoi;
869 
870  std::vector<Number> partialq_partialp(Nq, 0);
871  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
872  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
873  partialq_partialp[i] = (qoi_plus[i] - qoi_minus[i]) / (2.*delta_p);
874 
875  // Don't leave the parameter changed
876  *parameters[j] = old_parameter;
877 
878  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
879  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
880  sensitivities[i][j] = partialq_partialp[i] +
881  this->get_adjoint_rhs(i).dot(this->get_sensitivity_solution(j));
882  }
883 
884  // All parameters have been reset.
885  // We didn't cache the original rhs or matrix for memory reasons,
886  // but we can restore them to a state consistent solution -
887  // principle of least surprise.
888  this->assembly(true, true);
889  this->rhs->close();
890  this->matrix->close();
891  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
892 }
libMesh::ImplicitSystem::sensitivity_solve
virtual std::pair< unsigned int, Real > sensitivity_solve(const ParameterVector &parameters)
Definition: implicit_system.C:304
libMesh::System::get_sensitivity_solution
NumericVector< Number > & get_sensitivity_solution(unsigned int i=0)
Definition: system.C:931
libMesh::ExplicitSystem::rhs
NumericVector< Number > * rhs
Definition: explicit_system.h:122
libMesh::TOLERANCE
static const Real TOLERANCE
Definition: libmesh_common.h:127

NumericVector< Number > & libMesh::System::get_sensitivity_rhs ( unsigned int  i = 0)
inherited
Returns
a reference to one of the system's sensitivity rhs vectors, by default the one corresponding to the first parameter. By default these vectors are built by the library, using finite differences, when assemble_residual_derivatives() is called.

When assembled, this vector should hold -(partial R / partial p_i)

void libMesh::FrequencySystem::init_data ( )
protectedvirtual

Initializes the member data fields associated with the system, so that, e.g., assemble() may be used. The frequenices have to be set prior to calling init().

Reimplemented from libMesh::LinearImplicitSystem.

Definition at line 118 of file frequency_system.C.

References _finished_init, _finished_set_frequencies, libMesh::Parameters::get(), libMesh::System::get_equation_systems(), libMesh::Parameters::have_parameter(), libMesh::LinearImplicitSystem::init_data(), libMesh::libmesh_assert_greater(), libMesh::EquationSystems::parameters, set_current_frequency(), libMesh::START_LOG(), and libMesh::STOP_LOG().

119 {
120  // initialize parent data and additional solution vectors
121  LinearImplicitSystem::init_data();
122 
123  // Log how long initializing the system takes
124  START_LOG("init()", "FrequencySystem");
125 
126  EquationSystems& es =
127  this->get_equation_systems();
128 
129  // make sure we have frequencies to solve for
130  if (!_finished_set_frequencies)
131  {
132  /*
133  * when this system was read from file, check
134  * if this has a "n_frequencies" parameter,
135  * and initialize us with these.
136  */
137  if (es.parameters.have_parameter<unsigned int> ("n_frequencies"))
138  {
139  const unsigned int n_freq =
140  es.parameters.get<unsigned int>("n_frequencies");
141 
142  libmesh_assert_greater (n_freq, 0);
143 
144  _finished_set_frequencies = true;
145 
146  this->set_current_frequency(0);
147  }
148  else
149  libmesh_error_msg("ERROR: Need to set frequencies before calling init().");
150  }
151 
152  _finished_init = true;
153 
154  // Stop logging init()
155  STOP_LOG("init()", "FrequencySystem");
156 }

Gradient libMesh::System::point_gradient ( unsigned int  var,
const Point &  p,
const bool  insist_on_success = true 
) const
inherited

Returns the gradient of the solution variable var at the physical point p in the mesh, similarly to point_value.

Definition at line 2072 of file system.C.

References libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::broadcast(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::PointLocatorBase::enable_out_of_mesh_mode(), libMesh::System::get_mesh(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), mesh, libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::min(), libMesh::ParallelObject::n_processors(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), libMesh::MeshBase::sub_point_locator(), and libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::verify().

2073 {
2074  // This function must be called on every processor; there's no
2075  // telling where in the partition p falls.
2076  parallel_object_only();
2077 
2078  // And every processor had better agree about which point we're
2079  // looking for
2080 #ifndef NDEBUG
2081  this->comm().verify(p);
2082 #endif // NDEBUG
2083 
2084  // Get a reference to the mesh object associated with the system object that calls this function
2085  const MeshBase &mesh = this->get_mesh();
2086 
2087  // Use an existing PointLocator or create a new one
2088  AutoPtr<PointLocatorBase> locator_ptr = mesh.sub_point_locator();
2089  PointLocatorBase& locator = *locator_ptr;
2090 
2091  if (!insist_on_success)
2092  locator.enable_out_of_mesh_mode();
2093 
2094  // Get a pointer to the element that contains P
2095  const Elem *e = locator(p);
2096 
2097  Gradient grad_u;
2098 
2099  if (e && e->processor_id() == this->processor_id())
2100  grad_u = point_gradient(var, p, *e);
2101 
2102  // If I have an element containing p, then let's let everyone know
2103  processor_id_type lowest_owner =
2104  (e && (e->processor_id() == this->processor_id())) ?
2105  this->processor_id() : this->n_processors();
2106  this->comm().min(lowest_owner);
2107 
2108  // Everybody should get their value from a processor that was able
2109  // to compute it.
2110  // If nobody admits owning the point, we may have a problem.
2111  if (lowest_owner != this->n_processors())
2112  this->comm().broadcast(grad_u, lowest_owner);
2113  else
2114  libmesh_assert(!insist_on_success);
2115 
2116  return grad_u;
2117 }

Gradient libMesh::System::point_gradient ( unsigned int  var,
const Point &  p,
const Elem &  e 
) const
inherited

Returns the gradient of the solution variable var at the physical point p in local Elem e in the mesh, similarly to point_value.

Definition at line 2120 of file system.C.

References libMesh::TypeVector< T >::add_scaled(), libMesh::FEGenericBase< T >::build(), libMesh::Elem::contains_point(), libMesh::System::current_solution(), libMesh::Elem::dim(), libMesh::dof_map, libMesh::System::get_dof_map(), libMesh::FEInterface::inverse_map(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), and libMesh::DofObject::processor_id().

2121 {
2122  libmesh_assert_equal_to (e.processor_id(), this->processor_id());
2123 
2124  // Ensuring that the given point is really in the element is an
2125  // expensive assert, but as long as debugging is turned on we might
2126  // as well try to catch a particularly nasty potential error
2127  libmesh_assert (e.contains_point(p));
2128 
2129  // Get the dof map to get the proper indices for our computation
2130  const DofMap& dof_map = this->get_dof_map();
2131 
2132  // Need dof_indices for phi[i][j]
2133  std::vector<dof_id_type> dof_indices;
2134 
2135  // Fill in the dof_indices for our element
2136  dof_map.dof_indices (&e, dof_indices, var);
2137 
2138  // Get the no of dofs assciated with this point
2139  const unsigned int num_dofs = cast_int<unsigned int>
2140  (dof_indices.size());
2141 
2142  FEType fe_type = dof_map.variable_type(var);
2143 
2144  // Build a FE again so we can calculate u(p)
2145  AutoPtr<FEBase> fe (FEBase::build(e.dim(), fe_type));
2146 
2147  // Map the physical co-ordinates to the master co-ordinates using the inverse_map from fe_interface.h
2148  // Build a vector of point co-ordinates to send to reinit
2149  std::vector<Point> coor(1, FEInterface::inverse_map(e.dim(), fe_type, &e, p));
2150 
2151  // Get the values of the shape function derivatives
2152  const std::vector<std::vector<RealGradient> >& dphi = fe->get_dphi();
2153 
2154  // Reinitialize the element and compute the shape function values at coor
2155  fe->reinit (&e, &coor);
2156 
2157  // Get ready to accumulate a gradient
2158  Gradient grad_u;
2159 
2160  for (unsigned int l=0; l<num_dofs; l++)
2161  {
2162  grad_u.add_scaled (dphi[l][0], this->current_solution (dof_indices[l]));
2163  }
2164 
2165  return grad_u;
2166 }

2239 
2240  FEType fe_type = dof_map.variable_type(var);
2241 
2242  // Build a FE again so we can calculate u(p)
2243  AutoPtr<FEBase> fe (FEBase::build(e.dim(), fe_type));
2244 
2245  // Map the physical co-ordinates to the master co-ordinates using the inverse_map from fe_interface.h
2246  // Build a vector of point co-ordinates to send to reinit
2247  std::vector<Point> coor(1, FEInterface::inverse_map(e.dim(), fe_type, &e, p));
2248 
2249  // Get the values of the shape function derivatives
2250  const std::vector<std::vector<RealTensor> >& d2phi = fe->get_d2phi();
2251 
2252  // Reinitialize the element and compute the shape function values at coor
2253  fe->reinit (&e, &coor);
2254 
2255  // Get ready to accumulate a hessian
2256  Tensor hess_u;
2257 
2258  for (unsigned int l=0; l<num_dofs; l++)
2259  {
2260  hess_u.add_scaled (d2phi[l][0], this->current_solution (dof_indices[l]));
2261  }
2262 
2263  return hess_u;
2264 }

libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id

Definition: parallel_object.h:98
Number libMesh::System::point_value ( unsigned int  var,
const Point &  p,
const bool  insist_on_success = true 
) const
inherited

Returns the value of the solution variable var at the physical point p in the mesh, without knowing a priori which element contains p.

Note that this function uses MeshBase::sub_point_locator(); users may or may not want to call MeshBase::clear_point_locator() afterward. Also, point_locator() is expensive (N log N for initial construction, log N for evaluations). Avoid using this function in any context where you are already looping over elements.

Because the element containing p may lie on any processor, this function is parallel-only.

By default this method expects the point to reside inside the domain and will abort if no element can be found which contains . The optional parameter insist_on_success can be set to false to allow the method to return 0 when the point is not located.

Definition at line 1975 of file system.C.

References libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::broadcast(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::PointLocatorBase::enable_out_of_mesh_mode(), libMesh::System::get_mesh(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), mesh, libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::min(), libMesh::ParallelObject::n_processors(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), libMesh::MeshBase::sub_point_locator(), and libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::verify().

1976 {
1977  // This function must be called on every processor; there's no
1978  // telling where in the partition p falls.
1979  parallel_object_only();
1980 
1981  // And every processor had better agree about which point we're
1982  // looking for
1983 #ifndef NDEBUG
1984  this->comm().verify(p);
1985 #endif // NDEBUG
1986 
1987  // Get a reference to the mesh object associated with the system object that calls this function
1988  const MeshBase &mesh = this->get_mesh();
1989 
1990  // Use an existing PointLocator or create a new one
1991  AutoPtr<PointLocatorBase> locator_ptr = mesh.sub_point_locator();
1992  PointLocatorBase& locator = *locator_ptr;
1993 
1994  if (!insist_on_success)
1995  locator.enable_out_of_mesh_mode();
1996 
1997  // Get a pointer to the element that contains P
1998  const Elem *e = locator(p);
1999 
2000  Number u = 0;
2001 
2002  if (e && e->processor_id() == this->processor_id())
2003  u = point_value(var, p, *e);
2004 
2005  // If I have an element containing p, then let's let everyone know
2006  processor_id_type lowest_owner =
2007  (e && (e->processor_id() == this->processor_id())) ?
2008  this->processor_id() : this->n_processors();
2009  this->comm().min(lowest_owner);
2010 
2011  // Everybody should get their value from a processor that was able
2012  // to compute it.
2013  // If nobody admits owning the point, we have a problem.
2014  if (lowest_owner != this->n_processors())
2015  this->comm().broadcast(u, lowest_owner);
2016  else
2017  libmesh_assert(!insist_on_success);
2018 
2019  return u;
2020 }

Number libMesh::System::point_value ( unsigned int  var,
const Point &  p,
const Elem &  e 
) const
inherited

Returns the value of the solution variable var at the physical point p contained in local Elem e

This version of point_value can be run in serial, but assumes e is in the local mesh partition.

2027  // expensive assert, but as long as debugging is turned on we might

2063  {

2065  }
2066 
2067  return u;
2068 }

unsigned int rank() const
Definition: parallel.h:645
void libMesh::System::project_solution ( FunctionBase< Number > *  f,
FunctionBase< Gradient > *  g = NULL 
) const
inherited

Projects arbitrary functions onto the current solution. The function value f and its gradient g are user-provided cloneable functors. A gradient g is only required/used for projecting onto finite element spaces with continuous derivatives. If non-default Parameters are to be used, they can be provided in the parameters argument.

This method projects an arbitrary function onto the solution via L2 projections and nodal interpolations on each element.

) const
inherited

Projects arbitrary functions onto the current solution. The function value fptr and its gradient gptr are represented by function pointers. A gradient gptr is only required/used for projecting onto finite element spaces with continuous derivatives.

This method projects an arbitrary function onto the solution via L2 projections and nodal interpolations on each element.

bool& libMesh::System::project_solution_on_reinit ( void  )
inlineinherited

Tells the System whether or not to project the solution vector onto new grids when the system is reinitialized. The solution will be projected unless project_solution_on_reinit() = false is called.

Definition at line 783 of file system.h.

References libMesh::System::_solution_projection.

Referenced by libMesh::UniformRefinementEstimator::_estimate_error(), libMesh::AdjointRefinementEstimator::estimate_error(), and libMesh::MemorySolutionHistory::store().

libMesh::System::_solution_projection
bool _solution_projection
Definition: system.h:1872
void libMesh::System::project_vector ( NumericVector< Number > &  new_vector,
FunctionBase< Number > *  f,
FunctionBase< Gradient > *  g = NULL,
int  is_adjoint = -1 
) const
inherited

Projects arbitrary functions onto a vector of degree of freedom values for the current system. The function value f and its gradient g are user-provided cloneable functors. A gradient g is only required/used for projecting onto finite element spaces with continuous derivatives. If non-default Parameters are to be used, they can be provided in the parameters argument.

Constrain the new vector using the requested adjoint rather than primal constraints if is_adjoint is non-negative.

This method projects an arbitrary function via L2 projections and nodal interpolations on each element.

Definition at line 519 of file system_projection.C.

References libMesh::NumericVector< T >::close(), libMesh::dof_map, libMesh::DofMap::enforce_adjoint_constraints_exactly(), libMesh::DofMap::enforce_constraints_exactly(), libMesh::FEType::family, libMesh::System::get_dof_map(), libMesh::System::get_equation_systems(), libMesh::System::get_mesh(), libMesh::System::n_components(), libMesh::ParallelObject::n_processors(), libMesh::System::n_vars(), libMesh::Threads::parallel_for(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::SCALAR, libMesh::DofMap::SCALAR_dof_indices(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::set(), libMesh::START_LOG(), libMesh::STOP_LOG(), libMesh::System::time, libMesh::Variable::type(), libMesh::System::variable(), and libMesh::System::variable_scalar_number().

Referenced by libMesh::System::project_solution(), libMesh::System::project_vector(), and libMesh::System::restrict_vectors().

523 {
524  START_LOG ("project_vector()", "System");
525 
526  Threads::parallel_for
527  (ConstElemRange (this->get_mesh().active_local_elements_begin(),
528  this->get_mesh().active_local_elements_end() ),
529  ProjectSolution(*this, f, g,
530  this->get_equation_systems().parameters,
531  new_vector)
532  );
533 
534  // Also, load values into the SCALAR dofs
535  // Note: We assume that all SCALAR dofs are on the
536  // processor with highest ID
537  if(this->processor_id() == (this->n_processors()-1))
538  {
539  // We get different scalars as different
540  // components from a new-style f functor.
541  DenseVector<Number> fout(this->n_components());
542  bool filled_fout = false;
543 
544  const DofMap& dof_map = this->get_dof_map();
545  for (unsigned int var=0; var<this->n_vars(); var++)
546  if(this->variable(var).type().family == SCALAR)
547  {
548  if (!filled_fout)
549  {
550  (*f) (Point(), this->time, fout);
551  filled_fout = true;
552  }
553 
554  std::vector<dof_id_type> SCALAR_indices;
555  dof_map.SCALAR_dof_indices (SCALAR_indices, var);
556  const unsigned int n_SCALAR_dofs =
557  cast_int<unsigned int>(SCALAR_indices.size());
558 
559  for (unsigned int i=0; i<n_SCALAR_dofs; i++)
560  {
561  const dof_id_type global_index = SCALAR_indices[i];
562  const unsigned int component_index =
563  this->variable_scalar_number(var,i);
564  new_vector.set(global_index, fout(component_index));
565  }
566  }
567  }
568 
569  new_vector.close();
570 
571 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_CONSTRAINTS
572  if (is_adjoint == -1)
573  this->get_dof_map().enforce_constraints_exactly(*this, &new_vector);
574  else if (is_adjoint >= 0)
575  this->get_dof_map().enforce_adjoint_constraints_exactly(new_vector,
576  is_adjoint);
577 #endif
578 
579  STOP_LOG("project_vector()", "System");
580 }

libMesh::START_LOG
START_LOG("std::sqrt()","ExactErrorEstimator")
void libMesh::System::project_vector ( NumericVector< Number > &  new_vector,
FEMFunctionBase< Number > *  f,
FEMFunctionBase< Gradient > *  g = NULL,
int  is_adjoint = -1 
) const
inherited

Projects arbitrary functions onto a vector of degree of freedom values for the current system. The function value f and its gradient g are user-provided cloneable functors. A gradient g is only required/used for projecting onto finite element spaces with continuous derivatives. If non-default Parameters are to be used, they can be provided in the parameters argument.

Constrain the new vector using the requested adjoint rather than primal constraints if is_adjoint is non-negative.

This method projects an arbitrary function via L2 projections and nodal interpolations on each element.

Definition at line 587 of file system_projection.C.

591 {
592  START_LOG ("project_fem_vector()", "System");
593 
594  Threads::parallel_for
595  (ConstElemRange (this->get_mesh().active_local_elements_begin(),
596  this->get_mesh().active_local_elements_end() ),
597  ProjectFEMSolution(*this, f, g, new_vector)
598  );
599 
600  // Also, load values into the SCALAR dofs
601  // Note: We assume that all SCALAR dofs are on the
602  // processor with highest ID
603  if(this->processor_id() == (this->n_processors()-1))
604  {
605  // FIXME: Do we want to first check for SCALAR vars before building this? [PB]
606  FEMContext context( *this );
607 
608  const DofMap& dof_map = this->get_dof_map();
609  for (unsigned int var=0; var<this->n_vars(); var++)
610  if(this->variable(var).type().family == SCALAR)
611  {

613  // doesn't override FEMFunctionBase::component. Is there

627  this->variable_scalar_number(var,i);
628

630  }

void libMesh::System::project_vector ( Number   fptrconst Point &p,const Parameters &parameters,const std::string &sys_name,const std::string &unknown_name,

const Parameters &  parameters,
NumericVector< Number > &  new_vector,
int  is_adjoint = -1 
) const
inherited

Projects arbitrary functions onto a vector of degree of freedom values for the current system. The function value fptr and its gradient gptr are represented by function pointers. A gradient gptr is only required/used for projecting onto finite element spaces with continuous derivatives.

Constrain the new vector using the requested adjoint rather than primal constraints if is_adjoint is non-negative.

This method projects an arbitrary function via L2 projections and nodal interpolations on each element.

libMesh::System::project_vector
void project_vector(NumericVector< Number > &new_vector, FunctionBase< Number > *f, FunctionBase< Gradient > *g=NULL, int is_adjoint=-1) const
Definition: system_projection.C:519
void libMesh::System::project_vector ( NumericVector< Number > &  vector,
int  is_adjoint = -1 
) const
protectedinherited

Projects the vector defined on the old mesh onto the new mesh.

Constrain the new vector using the requested adjoint rather than primal constraints if is_adjoint is non-negative.

Definition at line 255 of file system_projection.C.

References libMesh::NumericVector< T >::clone(), and libMesh::System::project_vector().

257 {
258  // Create a copy of the vector, which currently
259  // contains the old data.
260  AutoPtr<NumericVector<Number> >
261  old_vector (vector.clone());
262 
263  // Project the old vector to the new vector
264  this->project_vector (*old_vector, vector, is_adjoint);
265 }
libMesh::NumericVector::clone
virtual AutoPtr< NumericVector< T > > clone() const =0
libMesh::System::project_vector
void project_vector(NumericVector< Number > &new_vector, FunctionBase< Number > *f, FunctionBase< Gradient > *g=NULL, int is_adjoint=-1) const
Definition: system_projection.C:519
void libMesh::System::project_vector ( const NumericVector< Number > &  old_v,
NumericVector< Number > &  new_v,
int  is_adjoint = -1 
) const
protectedinherited

Projects the vector defined on the old mesh onto the new mesh. The original vector is unchanged and the new vector is passed through the second argument.

Constrain the new vector using the requested adjoint rather than primal constraints if is_adjoint is non-negative.

This method projects the vector via L2 projections or nodal interpolations on each element.

This method projects a solution from an old mesh to a current, refined mesh. The input vector old_v gives the solution on the old mesh, while the new_v gives the solution (to be computed) on the new mesh.

Definition at line 273 of file system_projection.C.

References libMesh::NumericVector< T >::build(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::clear(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::close(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::dof_map, libMesh::DofMap::enforce_adjoint_constraints_exactly(), libMesh::DofMap::enforce_constraints_exactly(), libMesh::FEType::family, libMesh::AutoPtr< Tp >::get(), libMesh::System::get_dof_map(), libMesh::System::get_mesh(), libMesh::GHOSTED, libMesh::NumericVector< T >::init(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::local_size(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::localize(), libMesh::System::n_dofs(), libMesh::System::n_local_dofs(), libMesh::ParallelObject::n_processors(), libMesh::System::n_vars(), libMesh::PARALLEL, libMesh::Threads::parallel_for(), libMesh::Threads::parallel_reduce(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::SCALAR, libMesh::DofMap::SCALAR_dof_indices(), libMesh::BuildProjectionList::send_list, libMesh::SERIAL, libMesh::NumericVector< T >::set(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::size(), libMesh::START_LOG(), libMesh::STOP_LOG(), libMesh::Variable::type(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::type(), libMesh::BuildProjectionList::unique(), and libMesh::System::variable().

276 {
277  START_LOG ("project_vector()", "System");
278 
285  new_v.clear();
286 
287 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
288 
289  // Resize the new vector and get a serial version.
290  NumericVector<Number> *new_vector_ptr = NULL;
291  AutoPtr<NumericVector<Number> > new_vector_built;
292  NumericVector<Number> *local_old_vector;
293  AutoPtr<NumericVector<Number> > local_old_vector_built;
294  const NumericVector<Number> *old_vector_ptr = NULL;
295 
296  ConstElemRange active_local_elem_range
297  (this->get_mesh().active_local_elements_begin(),
298  this->get_mesh().active_local_elements_end());
299 
300  // If the old vector was uniprocessor, make the new
301  // vector uniprocessor
302  if (old_v.type() == SERIAL)
303  {
304  new_v.init (this->n_dofs(), false, SERIAL);
305  new_vector_ptr = &new_v;
306  old_vector_ptr = &old_v;
307  }
308 
309  // Otherwise it is a parallel, distributed vector, which
310  // we need to localize.
311  else if (old_v.type() == PARALLEL)
312  {
313  // Build a send list for efficient localization
314  BuildProjectionList projection_list(*this);
315  Threads::parallel_reduce (active_local_elem_range,
316  projection_list);
317 
318  // Create a sorted, unique send_list
319  projection_list.unique();
320 
321  new_v.init (this->n_dofs(), this->n_local_dofs(), false, PARALLEL);
322  new_vector_built = NumericVector<Number>::build(this->comm());
323  local_old_vector_built = NumericVector<Number>::build(this->comm());
324  new_vector_ptr = new_vector_built.get();
325  local_old_vector = local_old_vector_built.get();
326  new_vector_ptr->init(this->n_dofs(), false, SERIAL);
327  local_old_vector->init(old_v.size(), false, SERIAL);
328  old_v.localize(*local_old_vector, projection_list.send_list);
329  local_old_vector->close();
330  old_vector_ptr = local_old_vector;
331  }
332  else if (old_v.type() == GHOSTED)
333  {
334  // Build a send list for efficient localization
335  BuildProjectionList projection_list(*this);
336  Threads::parallel_reduce (active_local_elem_range,
337  projection_list);
338 
339  // Create a sorted, unique send_list
340  projection_list.unique();
341 
342  new_v.init (this->n_dofs(), this->n_local_dofs(),
343  this->get_dof_map().get_send_list(), false, GHOSTED);
344 
345  local_old_vector_built = NumericVector<Number>::build(this->comm());
346  new_vector_ptr = &new_v;
347  local_old_vector = local_old_vector_built.get();
348  local_old_vector->init(old_v.size(), old_v.local_size(),
349  projection_list.send_list, false, GHOSTED);
350  old_v.localize(*local_old_vector, projection_list.send_list);
351  local_old_vector->close();
352  old_vector_ptr = local_old_vector;
353  }
354  else // unknown old_v.type()
355  libmesh_error_msg("ERROR: Unknown old_v.type() == " << old_v.type());
356 
357  // Note that the above will have zeroed the new_vector.
358  // Just to be sure, assert that new_vector_ptr and old_vector_ptr
359  // were successfully set before trying to deref them.
360  libmesh_assert(new_vector_ptr);
361  libmesh_assert(old_vector_ptr);
362 
363  NumericVector<Number> &new_vector = *new_vector_ptr;
364  const NumericVector<Number> &old_vector = *old_vector_ptr;
365 
366  Threads::parallel_for (active_local_elem_range,
367  ProjectVector(*this,
368  old_vector,
369  new_vector)
370  );
371 
372  // Copy the SCALAR dofs from old_vector to new_vector
373  // Note: We assume that all SCALAR dofs are on the
374  // processor with highest ID
375  if(this->processor_id() == (this->n_processors()-1))
376  {
377  const DofMap& dof_map = this->get_dof_map();
378  for (unsigned int var=0; var<this->n_vars(); var++)
379  if(this->variable(var).type().family == SCALAR)
380  {
381  // We can just map SCALAR dofs directly across
382  std::vector<dof_id_type> new_SCALAR_indices, old_SCALAR_indices;
383  dof_map.SCALAR_dof_indices (new_SCALAR_indices, var, false);
384  dof_map.SCALAR_dof_indices (old_SCALAR_indices, var, true);
385  const unsigned int new_n_dofs =
386  cast_int<unsigned int>(new_SCALAR_indices.size());
387 
388  for (unsigned int i=0; i<new_n_dofs; i++)
389  {
390  new_vector.set( new_SCALAR_indices[i], old_vector(old_SCALAR_indices[i]) );
391  }
392  }
393  }
394 
395  new_vector.close();
396 
397  // If the old vector was serial, we probably need to send our values
398  // to other processors
399  //
400  // FIXME: I'm not sure how to make a NumericVector do that without
401  // creating a temporary parallel vector to use localize! - RHS
402  if (old_v.type() == SERIAL)
403  {
404  AutoPtr<NumericVector<Number> > dist_v = NumericVector<Number>::build(this->comm());
405  dist_v->init(this->n_dofs(), this->n_local_dofs(), false, PARALLEL);
406  dist_v->close();
407 
408  for (dof_id_type i=0; i!=dist_v->size(); i++)
409  if (new_vector(i) != 0.0)
410  dist_v->set(i, new_vector(i));
411 
412  dist_v->close();
413 
414  dist_v->localize (new_v, this->get_dof_map().get_send_list());
415  new_v.close();
416  }
417  // If the old vector was parallel, we need to update it
418  // and free the localized copies
419  else if (old_v.type() == PARALLEL)
420  {
421  // We may have to set dof values that this processor doesn't
422  // own in certain special cases, like LAGRANGE FIRST or
423  // HERMITE THIRD elements on second-order meshes
424  for (dof_id_type i=0; i!=new_v.size(); i++)
425  if (new_vector(i) != 0.0)
426  new_v.set(i, new_vector(i));
427  new_v.close();
428  }
429 
430  if (is_adjoint == -1)
431  this->get_dof_map().enforce_constraints_exactly(*this, &new_v);
432  else if (is_adjoint >= 0)
433  this->get_dof_map().enforce_adjoint_constraints_exactly(new_v,
434  is_adjoint);
435 
436 #else
437 
438  // AMR is disabled: simply copy the vector
439  new_v = old_v;
440 
441 #endif // #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_AMR
442 
443  STOP_LOG("project_vector()", "System");
444 }

libMesh::System::restrict_vectors

Definition: system.C:319
void libMesh::ImplicitSystem::qoi_parameter_hessian ( const QoISet &  qoi_indices,
const ParameterVector &  parameters,
SensitivityData &  hessian 
)
virtualinherited

For each of the system's quantities of interest q in qoi[qoi_indices], and for a vector of parameters p, the parameter sensitivity Hessian H_ij is defined as H_ij = (d^2 q)/(d p_i d p_j) This Hessian is the output of this method, where for each q_i, H_jk is stored in hessian.second_derivative(i,j,k).

Reimplemented from libMesh::System.

Definition at line 1097 of file implicit_system.C.

References libMesh::SensitivityData::allocate_hessian_data(), libMesh::QoISet::has_index(), libMesh::Real, libMesh::SensitivityData::second_derivative(), libMesh::ParameterVector::size(), and libMesh::TOLERANCE.

1100 {
1101  // We currently get partial derivatives via finite differencing
1102  const Real delta_p = TOLERANCE;
1103 
1104  // We'll use one temporary vector for matrix-vector-vector products
1105  AutoPtr<NumericVector<Number> > tempvec = this->solution->zero_clone();
1106 
1107  // And another temporary vector to hold a copy of the true solution
1108  // so we can safely perturb this->solution.
1109  AutoPtr<NumericVector<Number> > oldsolution = this->solution->clone();
1110 
1111  const unsigned int Np = cast_int<unsigned int>
1112  (parameters.size());
1113  const unsigned int Nq = cast_int<unsigned int>
1114  (qoi.size());
1115 
1116  // For each quantity of interest q, the parameter sensitivity
1117  // Hessian is defined as q''_{kl} = {d^2 q}/{d p_k d p_l}.
1118  //
1119  // We calculate it from values and partial derivatives of the
1120  // quantity of interest function Q, solution u, adjoint solution z,
1121  // and residual R, as:
1122  //
1123  // q''_{kl} =
1124  // Q''_{kl} + Q''_{uk}(u)*u'_l + Q''_{ul}(u) * u'_k +
1125  // Q''_{uu}(u)*u'_k*u'_l -
1126  // R''_{kl}(u,z) -
1127  // R''_{uk}(u,z)*u'_l - R''_{ul}(u,z)*u'_k -
1128  // R''_{uu}(u,z)*u'_k*u'_l
1129  //
1130  // See the adjoints model document for more details.
1131 
1132  // We first do an adjoint solve to get z for each quantity of
1133  // interest
1134  // if we havent already or dont have an initial condition for the adjoint
1135  if (!this->is_adjoint_already_solved())
1136  {
1137  this->adjoint_solve(qoi_indices);
1138  }
1139 
1140  // And a sensitivity solve to get u_k for each parameter
1141  this->sensitivity_solve(parameters);
1142 
1143  // Get ready to fill in second derivatives:
1144  sensitivities.allocate_hessian_data(qoi_indices, *this, parameters);
1145 
1146  for (unsigned int k=0; k != Np; ++k)
1147  {
1148  Number old_parameterk = *parameters[k];
1149 
1150  // The Hessian is symmetric, so we just calculate the lower
1151  // triangle and the diagonal, and we get the upper triangle from
1152  // the transpose of the lower
1153 
1154  for (unsigned int l=0; l != k+1; ++l)
1155  {
1156  // The second partial derivatives with respect to parameters
1157  // are all calculated via a central finite difference
1158  // stencil:
1159  // F''_{kl} ~= (F(p+dp*e_k+dp*e_l) - F(p+dp*e_k-dp*e_l) -
1160  // F(p-dp*e_k+dp*e_l) + F(p-dp*e_k-dp*e_l))/(4*dp^2)
1161  // We will add Q''_{kl}(u) and subtract R''_{kl}(u,z) at the
1162  // same time.
1163  //
1164  // We have to be careful with the perturbations to handle
1165  // the k=l case
1166 
1167  Number old_parameterl = *parameters[l];
1168 
1169  *parameters[k] += delta_p;
1170  *parameters[l] += delta_p;
1171  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
1172  this->assembly(true, false);
1173  this->rhs->close();
1174  std::vector<Number> partial2q_term = this->qoi;
1175  std::vector<Number> partial2R_term(this->qoi.size());
1176  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
1177  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
1178  partial2R_term[i] = this->rhs->dot(this->get_adjoint_solution(i));
1179 
1180  *parameters[l] -= 2.*delta_p;
1181  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
1182  this->assembly(true, false);
1183  this->rhs->close();
1184  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
1185  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
1186  {
1187  partial2q_term[i] -= this->qoi[i];
1188  partial2R_term[i] -= this->rhs->dot(this->get_adjoint_solution(i));
1189  }
1190 
1191  *parameters[k] -= 2.*delta_p;
1192  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
1193  this->assembly(true, false);
1194  this->rhs->close();
1195  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
1196  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
1197  {
1198  partial2q_term[i] += this->qoi[i];
1199  partial2R_term[i] += this->rhs->dot(this->get_adjoint_solution(i));
1200  }
1201 
1202  *parameters[l] += 2.*delta_p;
1203  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
1204  this->assembly(true, false);
1205  this->rhs->close();
1206  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
1207  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
1208  {
1209  partial2q_term[i] -= this->qoi[i];
1210  partial2R_term[i] -= this->rhs->dot(this->get_adjoint_solution(i));
1211  partial2q_term[i] /= (4. * delta_p * delta_p);
1212  partial2R_term[i] /= (4. * delta_p * delta_p);
1213  }
1214 
1215  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
1216  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
1217  {
1218  Number current_terms = partial2q_term[i] - partial2R_term[i];
1219  sensitivities.second_derivative(i,k,l) += current_terms;
1220  if (k != l)
1221  sensitivities.second_derivative(i,l,k) += current_terms;
1222  }
1223 
1224  // Don't leave the parameters perturbed
1225  *parameters[l] = old_parameterl;
1226  *parameters[k] = old_parameterk;
1227  }
1228 
1229  // We get (partial q / partial u) and
1230  // (partial R / partial u) from the user, but centrally
1231  // difference to get q_uk and R_uk terms:
1232  // (partial^2 q / partial u partial k)
1233  // q_uk*u'_l = (q_u(p+dp*e_k)*u'_l - q_u(p-dp*e_k)*u'_l)/(2*dp)
1234  // R_uk*z*u'_l = (R_u(p+dp*e_k)*z*u'_l - R_u(p-dp*e_k)*z*u'_l)/(2*dp)
1235  //
1236  // To avoid creating Nq temporary vectors, we add these
1237  // subterms to the sensitivities output one by one.
1238  //
1239  // FIXME: this is probably a bad order of operations for
1240  // controlling floating point error.
1241 
1242  *parameters[k] = old_parameterk + delta_p;
1243  this->assembly(false, true);
1244  this->matrix->close();
1245  this->assemble_qoi_derivative(qoi_indices);
1246 
1247  for (unsigned int l=0; l != Np; ++l)
1248  {
1249  this->matrix->vector_mult(*tempvec, this->get_sensitivity_solution(l));
1250  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
1251  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
1252  {
1253  this->get_adjoint_rhs(i).close();
1254  Number current_terms =
1255  (this->get_adjoint_rhs(i).dot(this->get_sensitivity_solution(l)) -
1256  tempvec->dot(this->get_adjoint_solution(i))) / (2.*delta_p);
1257  sensitivities.second_derivative(i,k,l) += current_terms;
1258 
1259  // We use the _uk terms twice; symmetry lets us reuse
1260  // these calculations for the _ul terms.
1261 
1262  sensitivities.second_derivative(i,l,k) += current_terms;
1263  }
1264  }
1265 
1266  *parameters[k] = old_parameterk - delta_p;
1267  this->assembly(false, true);
1268  this->matrix->close();
1269  this->assemble_qoi_derivative(qoi_indices);
1270 
1271  for (unsigned int l=0; l != Np; ++l)
1272  {
1273  this->matrix->vector_mult(*tempvec, this->get_sensitivity_solution(l));
1274  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
1275  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
1276  {
1277  this->get_adjoint_rhs(i).close();
1278  Number current_terms =
1279  (-this->get_adjoint_rhs(i).dot(this->get_sensitivity_solution(l)) +
1280  tempvec->dot(this->get_adjoint_solution(i))) / (2.*delta_p);
1281  sensitivities.second_derivative(i,k,l) += current_terms;
1282 
1283  // We use the _uk terms twice; symmetry lets us reuse
1284  // these calculations for the _ul terms.
1285 
1286  sensitivities.second_derivative(i,l,k) += current_terms;
1287  }
1288  }
1289 
1290  // Don't leave the parameter perturbed
1291  *parameters[k] = old_parameterk;
1292 
1293  // Our last remaining terms are -R_uu(u,z)*u_k*u_l and
1294  // Q_uu(u)*u_k*u_l
1295  //
1296  // We take directional central finite differences of R_u and Q_u
1297  // to approximate these terms, e.g.:
1298  //
1299  // Q_uu(u)*u_k ~= (Q_u(u+dp*u_k) - Q_u(u-dp*u_k))/(2*dp)
1300 
1301  *this->solution = this->get_sensitivity_solution(k);
1302  *this->solution *= delta_p;
1303  *this->solution += *oldsolution;
1304  this->assembly(false, true);
1305  this->matrix->close();
1306  this->assemble_qoi_derivative(qoi_indices);
1307 
1308  // The Hessian is symmetric, so we just calculate the lower
1309  // triangle and the diagonal, and we get the upper triangle from
1310  // the transpose of the lower
1311  //
1312  // Note that, because we took the directional finite difference
1313  // with respect to k and not l, we've added an O(delta_p^2)
1314  // error to any permutational symmetry in the Hessian...
1315  for (unsigned int l=0; l != k+1; ++l)
1316  {
1317  this->matrix->vector_mult(*tempvec, this->get_sensitivity_solution(l));
1318  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
1319  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
1320  {
1321  this->get_adjoint_rhs(i).close();
1322  Number current_terms =
1323  (this->get_adjoint_rhs(i).dot(this->get_sensitivity_solution(l)) -
1324  tempvec->dot(this->get_adjoint_solution(i))) / (2.*delta_p);
1325  sensitivities.second_derivative(i,k,l) += current_terms;
1326  if (k != l)
1327  sensitivities.second_derivative(i,l,k) += current_terms;
1328  }
1329  }
1330 
1331  *this->solution = this->get_sensitivity_solution(k);
1332  *this->solution *= -delta_p;
1333  *this->solution += *oldsolution;
1334  this->assembly(false, true);
1335  this->matrix->close();
1336  this->assemble_qoi_derivative(qoi_indices);
1337 
1338  for (unsigned int l=0; l != k+1; ++l)
1339  {
1340  this->matrix->vector_mult(*tempvec, this->get_sensitivity_solution(l));
1341  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
1342  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
1343  {
1344  this->get_adjoint_rhs(i).close();
1345  Number current_terms =
1346  (-this->get_adjoint_rhs(i).dot(this->get_sensitivity_solution(l)) +
1347  tempvec->dot(this->get_adjoint_solution(i))) / (2.*delta_p);
1348  sensitivities.second_derivative(i,k,l) += current_terms;
1349  if (k != l)
1350  sensitivities.second_derivative(i,l,k) += current_terms;
1351  }
1352  }
1353 
1354  // Don't leave the solution perturbed
1355  *this->solution = *oldsolution;
1356  }
1357 
1358  // All parameters have been reset.
1359  // Don't leave the qoi or system changed - principle of least
1360  // surprise.
1361  this->assembly(true, true);
1362  this->rhs->close();
1363  this->matrix->close();
1364  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
1365 }
libMesh::ImplicitSystem::sensitivity_solve

libMesh::ImplicitSystem::adjoint_solve

libMesh::Real

libMesh::ImplicitSystem::matrix

libMesh::System::get_adjoint_solution

Definition: system.C:984
libMesh::Number

Definition: libmesh_common.h:172
libMesh::ImplicitSystem::assembly
