Definition: implicit_system.h:149
libMesh::System::solution
AutoPtr< NumericVector< Number > > solution
Definition: system.h:1496
libMesh::System::get_adjoint_rhs
NumericVector< Number > & get_adjoint_rhs(unsigned int i=0)
Definition: system.C:1046
void libMesh::ImplicitSystem::qoi_parameter_hessian_vector_product ( const QoISet &  qoi_indices,
const ParameterVector &  parameters,
const ParameterVector &  vector,
SensitivityData &  product 
)
virtualinherited

For each of the system's quantities of interest q in qoi[qoi_indices], and for a vector of parameters p, the parameter sensitivity Hessian H_ij is defined as H_ij = (d^2 q)/(d p_i d p_j) The Hessian-vector product, for a vector v_k in parameter space, is S_j = H_jk v_k This product is the output of this method, where for each q_i, S_j is stored in sensitivities[i][j].

Reimplemented from libMesh::System.

Definition at line 897 of file implicit_system.C.

References libMesh::SensitivityData::allocate_data(), libMesh::ParameterVector::deep_copy(), libMesh::QoISet::has_index(), libMesh::Real, libMesh::ParameterVector::size(), libMesh::TOLERANCE, and libMesh::ParameterVector::value_copy().

901 {
902  // We currently get partial derivatives via finite differencing
903  const Real delta_p = TOLERANCE;
904 
905  // We'll use a single temporary vector for matrix-vector-vector products
906  AutoPtr<NumericVector<Number> > tempvec = this->solution->zero_clone();
907 
908  const unsigned int Np = cast_int<unsigned int>
909  (parameters.size());
910  const unsigned int Nq = cast_int<unsigned int>
911  (qoi.size());
912 
913  // For each quantity of interest q, the parameter sensitivity
914  // Hessian is defined as q''_{kl} = {d^2 q}/{d p_k d p_l}.
915  // Given a vector of parameter perturbation weights w_l, this
916  // function evaluates the hessian-vector product sum_l(q''_{kl}*w_l)
917  //
918  // We calculate it from values and partial derivatives of the
919  // quantity of interest function Q, solution u, adjoint solution z,
920  // parameter sensitivity adjoint solutions z^l, and residual R, as:
921  //
922  // sum_l(q''_{kl}*w_l) =
923  // sum_l(w_l * Q''_{kl}) + Q''_{uk}(u)*(sum_l(w_l u'_l)) -
924  // R'_k(u, sum_l(w_l*z^l)) - R'_{uk}(u,z)*(sum_l(w_l u'_l) -
925  // sum_l(w_l*R''_{kl}(u,z))
926  //
927  // See the adjoints model document for more details.
928 
929  // We first do an adjoint solve to get z for each quantity of
930  // interest
931  // if we havent already or dont have an initial condition for the adjoint
932  if (!this->is_adjoint_already_solved())
933  {
934  this->adjoint_solve(qoi_indices);
935  }
936 
937  // Get ready to fill in senstivities:
938  sensitivities.allocate_data(qoi_indices, *this, parameters);
939 
940  // We can't solve for all the solution sensitivities u'_l or for all
941  // of the parameter sensitivity adjoint solutions z^l without
942  // requiring O(Nq*Np) linear solves. So we'll solve directly for their
943  // weighted sum - this is just O(Nq) solves.
944 
945  // First solve for sum_l(w_l u'_l).
946  this->weighted_sensitivity_solve(parameters, vector);
947 
948  // Then solve for sum_l(w_l z^l).
949  this->weighted_sensitivity_adjoint_solve(parameters, vector, qoi_indices);
950 
951  for (unsigned int k=0; k != Np; ++k)
952  {
953  // We approximate sum_l(w_l * Q''_{kl}) with a central
954  // differencing pertubation:
955  // sum_l(w_l * Q''_{kl}) ~=
956  // (Q(p + dp*w_l*e_l + dp*e_k) - Q(p - dp*w_l*e_l + dp*e_k) -
957  // Q(p + dp*w_l*e_l - dp*e_k) + Q(p - dp*w_l*e_l - dp*e_k))/(4*dp^2)
958 
959  // The sum(w_l*R''_kl) term requires the same sort of pertubation,
960  // and so we subtract it in at the same time:
961  // sum_l(w_l * R''_{kl}) ~=
962  // (R(p + dp*w_l*e_l + dp*e_k) - R(p - dp*w_l*e_l + dp*e_k) -
963  // R(p + dp*w_l*e_l - dp*e_k) + R(p - dp*w_l*e_l - dp*e_k))/(4*dp^2)
964 
965  ParameterVector oldparameters, parameterperturbation;
966  parameters.deep_copy(oldparameters);
967  vector.deep_copy(parameterperturbation);
968  parameterperturbation *= delta_p;
969  parameters += parameterperturbation;
970 
971  Number old_parameter = *parameters[k];
972 
973  *parameters[k] = old_parameter + delta_p;
974  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
975  this->assembly(true, false);
976  this->rhs->close();
977  std::vector<Number> partial2q_term = this->qoi;
978  std::vector<Number> partial2R_term(this->qoi.size());
979  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
980  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
981  partial2R_term[i] = this->rhs->dot(this->get_adjoint_solution(i));
982 
983  *parameters[k] = old_parameter - delta_p;
984  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
985  this->assembly(true, false);
986  this->rhs->close();
987  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
988  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
989  {
990  partial2q_term[i] -= this->qoi[i];
991  partial2R_term[i] -= this->rhs->dot(this->get_adjoint_solution(i));
992  }
993 
994  oldparameters.value_copy(parameters);
995  parameterperturbation *= -1.0;
996  parameters += parameterperturbation;
997 
998  // Re-center old_parameter, which may be affected by vector
999  old_parameter = *parameters[k];
1000 
1001  *parameters[k] = old_parameter + delta_p;
1002  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
1003  this->assembly(true, false);
1004  this->rhs->close();
1005  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
1006  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
1007  {
1008  partial2q_term[i] -= this->qoi[i];
1009  partial2R_term[i] -= this->rhs->dot(this->get_adjoint_solution(i));
1010  }
1011 
1012  *parameters[k] = old_parameter - delta_p;
1013  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
1014  this->assembly(true, false);
1015  this->rhs->close();
1016  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
1017  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
1018  {
1019  partial2q_term[i] += this->qoi[i];
1020  partial2R_term[i] += this->rhs->dot(this->get_adjoint_solution(i));
1021  }
1022 
1023  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
1024  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
1025  {
1026  partial2q_term[i] /= (4. * delta_p * delta_p);
1027  partial2R_term[i] /= (4. * delta_p * delta_p);
1028  }
1029 
1030  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
1031  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
1032  sensitivities[i][k] = partial2q_term[i] - partial2R_term[i];
1033 
1034  // We get (partial q / partial u), R, and
1035  // (partial R / partial u) from the user, but centrally
1036  // difference to get q_uk, R_k, and R_uk terms:
1037  // (partial R / partial k)
1038  // R_k*sum(w_l*z^l) = (R(p+dp*e_k)*sum(w_l*z^l) - R(p-dp*e_k)*sum(w_l*z^l))/(2*dp)
1039  // (partial^2 q / partial u partial k)
1040  // q_uk = (q_u(p+dp*e_k) - q_u(p-dp*e_k))/(2*dp)
1041  // (partial^2 R / partial u partial k)
1042  // R_uk*z*sum(w_l*u'_l) = (R_u(p+dp*e_k)*z*sum(w_l*u'_l) - R_u(p-dp*e_k)*z*sum(w_l*u'_l))/(2*dp)
1043 
1044  // To avoid creating Nq temporary vectors for q_uk or R_uk, we add
1045  // subterms to the sensitivities output one by one.
1046  //
1047  // FIXME: this is probably a bad order of operations for
1048  // controlling floating point error.
1049 
1050  *parameters[k] = old_parameter + delta_p;
1051  this->assembly(true, true);
1052  this->rhs->close();
1053  this->matrix->close();
1054  this->assemble_qoi_derivative(qoi_indices);
1055 
1056  this->matrix->vector_mult(*tempvec, this->get_weighted_sensitivity_solution());
1057 
1058  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
1059  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
1060  {
1061  this->get_adjoint_rhs(i).close();
1062  sensitivities[i][k] += (this->get_adjoint_rhs(i).dot(this->get_weighted_sensitivity_solution()) -
1063  this->rhs->dot(this->get_weighted_sensitivity_adjoint_solution(i)) -
1064  this->get_adjoint_solution(i).dot(*tempvec)) / (2.*delta_p);
1065  }
1066 
1067  *parameters[k] = old_parameter - delta_p;
1068  this->assembly(true, true);
1069  this->rhs->close();
1070  this->matrix->close();
1071  this->assemble_qoi_derivative(qoi_indices);
1072 
1073  this->matrix->vector_mult(*tempvec, this->get_weighted_sensitivity_solution());
1074 
1075  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
1076  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
1077  {
1078  this->get_adjoint_rhs(i).close();
1079  sensitivities[i][k] += (-this->get_adjoint_rhs(i).dot(this->get_weighted_sensitivity_solution()) +
1080  this->rhs->dot(this->get_weighted_sensitivity_adjoint_solution(i)) +
1081  this->get_adjoint_solution(i).dot(*tempvec)) / (2.*delta_p);
1082  }
1083  }
1084 
1085  // All parameters have been reset.
1086  // Don't leave the qoi or system changed - principle of least
1087  // surprise.
1088  this->assembly(true, true);
1089  this->rhs->close();
1090  this->matrix->close();
1091  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
1092 }
libMesh::ImplicitSystem::weighted_sensitivity_adjoint_solve

libMesh::System::get_weighted_sensitivity_adjoint_solution
NumericVector< Number > & get_weighted_sensitivity_adjoint_solution(unsigned int i=0)
Definition: system.C:1016
libMesh::System::get_adjoint_rhs
NumericVector< Number > & get_adjoint_rhs(unsigned int i=0)
Definition: system.C:1046
void libMesh::System::qoi_parameter_sensitivity ( const QoISet &  qoi_indices,
const ParameterVector &  parameters,
SensitivityData &  sensitivities 
)
virtualinherited

Solves for the derivative of each of the system's quantities of interest q in qoi[qoi_indices] with respect to each parameter in parameters, placing the result for qoi i and parameter j into sensitivities[i][j].

Note that parameters is a const vector, not a vector-of-const; parameter values in this vector need to be mutable for finite differencing to work.

Automatically chooses the forward method for problems with more quantities of interest than parameters, or the adjoint method otherwise.

This method is only usable in derived classes which overload an implementation.

Definition at line 511 of file system.C.

References libMesh::ParameterVector::size(), and libMesh::QoISet::size().

514 {
515  // Forward sensitivities are more efficient for Nq > Np
516  if (qoi_indices.size(*this) > parameters.size())
517  forward_qoi_parameter_sensitivity(qoi_indices, parameters, sensitivities);
518  // Adjoint sensitivities are more efficient for Np > Nq,
519  // and an adjoint may be more reusable than a forward
520  // solution sensitivity in the Np == Nq case.
521  else
522  adjoint_qoi_parameter_sensitivity(qoi_indices, parameters, sensitivities);
523 }
libMesh::System::forward_qoi_parameter_sensitivity
virtual void forward_qoi_parameter_sensitivity(const QoISet &qoi_indices, const ParameterVector &parameters, SensitivityData &sensitivities)
Definition: system.h:2218

virtual void adjoint_qoi_parameter_sensitivity(const QoISet &qoi_indices, const ParameterVector &parameters, SensitivityData &sensitivities)
Definition: system.h:2209
void libMesh::System::re_update ( )
virtualinherited

Re-update the local values when the mesh has changed. This method takes the data updated by update() and makes it up-to-date on the current mesh.

Reimplemented in libMesh::TransientSystem< RBConstruction >.

Definition at line 115 of file system_io.C.

References libMesh::System::_additional_data_written, libMesh::System::_written_var_indices, libMesh::System::add_variable(), libMesh::System::add_vector(), libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::broadcast(), libMesh::System::clear(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::Xdr::data(), libMesh::FEType::family, libMesh::System::get_mesh(), libMesh::FEType::inf_map, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::MeshBase::mesh_dimension(), libMesh::MONOMIAL, libMesh::on_command_line(), libMesh::FEType::order, libMesh::out, libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::FEType::radial_family, libMesh::FEType::radial_order, libMesh::Xdr::reading(), libMesh::System::variable_number(), libMesh::Xdr::version(), and libMesh::XYZ.

Referenced by libMesh::EquationSystems::_read_impl().

120 {
121  // This method implements the input of a
122  // System object, embedded in the output of
123  // an EquationSystems<T_sys>. This warrants some
124  // documentation. The output file essentially
125  // consists of 5 sections:
126  //
127  // for this system
128  //
129  // 5.) The number of variables in the system (unsigned int)
130  //
131  // for each variable in the system
132  //
133  // 6.) The name of the variable (string)
134  //
135  // 6.1.) Variable subdmains
136  //
137  // 7.) Combined in an FEType:
138  // - The approximation order(s) of the variable
139  // (Order Enum, cast to int/s)
140  // - The finite element family/ies of the variable
141  // (FEFamily Enum, cast to int/s)
142  //
143  // end variable loop
144  //
145  // 8.) The number of additional vectors (unsigned int),
146  //
147  // for each additional vector in the system object
148  //
149  // 9.) the name of the additional vector (string)
150  //
151  // end system
152  libmesh_assert (io.reading());
153 
154  // Possibly clear data structures and start from scratch.
155  if (read_header_in)
156  this->clear ();
157 
158  // Figure out if we need to read infinite element information.
159  // This will be true if the version string contains " with infinite elements"
160  const bool read_ifem_info =
161  (version.rfind(" with infinite elements") < version.size()) ||
162  libMesh::on_command_line ("--read_ifem_systems");
163 
164 
165  {
166  // 5.)
167  // Read the number of variables in the system
168  unsigned int nv=0;
169  if (this->processor_id() == 0)
170  io.data (nv);
171  this->comm().broadcast(nv);
172 
173  _written_var_indices.clear();
174  _written_var_indices.resize(nv, 0);
175 
176  for (unsigned int var=0; var<nv; var++)
177  {
178  // 6.)
179  // Read the name of the var-th variable
180  std::string var_name;
181  if (this->processor_id() == 0)
182  io.data (var_name);
183  this->comm().broadcast(var_name);
184 
185  // 6.1.)
186  std::set<subdomain_id_type> domains;
187  if (io.version() >= LIBMESH_VERSION_ID(0,7,2))
188  {
189  std::vector<subdomain_id_type> domain_array;
190  if (this->processor_id() == 0)
191  io.data (domain_array);
192  for (std::vector<subdomain_id_type>::iterator it = domain_array.begin(); it != domain_array.end(); ++it)
193  domains.insert(*it);
194  }
195  this->comm().broadcast(domains);
196 
197  // 7.)
198  // Read the approximation order(s) of the var-th variable
199  int order=0;
200  if (this->processor_id() == 0)
201  io.data (order);
202  this->comm().broadcast(order);
203 
204 
205  // do the same for infinite element radial_order
206  int rad_order=0;
207  if (read_ifem_info)
208  {
209  if (this->processor_id() == 0)
210  io.data(rad_order);
211  this->comm().broadcast(rad_order);
212  }
213 
214  // Read the finite element type of the var-th variable
215  int fam=0;
216  if (this->processor_id() == 0)
217  io.data (fam);
218  this->comm().broadcast(fam);
219  FEType type;
220  type.order = static_cast<Order>(order);
221  type.family = static_cast<FEFamily>(fam);
222 
223  // Check for incompatibilities. The shape function indexing was
224  // changed for the monomial and xyz finite element families to
225  // simplify extension to arbitrary p. The consequence is that
226  // old restart files will not be read correctly. This is expected
227  // to be an unlikely occurance, but catch it anyway.
228  if (read_legacy_format)
229  if ((type.family == MONOMIAL || type.family == XYZ) &&
230  ((type.order > 2 && this->get_mesh().mesh_dimension() == 2) ||
231  (type.order > 1 && this->get_mesh().mesh_dimension() == 3)))
232  {
233  libmesh_here();
234  libMesh::out << "*****************************************************************\n"
235  << "* WARNING: reading a potentially incompatible restart file!!! *\n"
236  << "* contact libmesh-users@lists.sourceforge.net for more details *\n"
237  << "*****************************************************************"
238  << std::endl;
239  }
240 
241  // Read additional information for infinite elements
242  int radial_fam=0;
243  int i_map=0;
244  if (read_ifem_info)
245  {
246  if (this->processor_id() == 0)
247  io.data (radial_fam);
248  this->comm().broadcast(radial_fam);
249  if (this->processor_id() == 0)
250  io.data (i_map);
251  this->comm().broadcast(i_map);
252  }
253 
254 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_INFINITE_ELEMENTS
255 
256  type.radial_order = static_cast<Order>(rad_order);
257  type.radial_family = static_cast<FEFamily>(radial_fam);
258  type.inf_map = static_cast<InfMapType>(i_map);
259 
260 #endif
261 
262  if (read_header_in)
263  {
264  if (domains.empty())
265  _written_var_indices[var] = this->add_variable (var_name, type);
266  else
267  _written_var_indices[var] = this->add_variable (var_name, type, &domains);
268  }
269  else
270  _written_var_indices[var] = this->variable_number(var_name);
271  }
272  }
273 
274  // 8.)
275  // Read the number of additional vectors.
276  unsigned int nvecs=0;
277  if (this->processor_id() == 0)
278  io.data (nvecs);
279  this->comm().broadcast(nvecs);
280 
281  // If nvecs > 0, this means that write_additional_data
282  // was true when this file was written. We will need to
283  // make use of this fact later.
284  if (nvecs > 0)
285  this->_additional_data_written = true;
286 
287  for (unsigned int vec=0; vec<nvecs; vec++)
288  {
289  // 9.)
290  // Read the name of the vec-th additional vector
291  std::string vec_name;
292  if (this->processor_id() == 0)
293  io.data (vec_name);
294  this->comm().broadcast(vec_name);
295 
296  if (read_additional_data)
297  {
298  // Systems now can handle adding post-initialization vectors
299  // libmesh_assert(this->_can_add_vectors);
300  // Some systems may have added their own vectors already
301  // libmesh_assert_equal_to (this->_vectors.count(vec_name), 0);
302 
303  this->add_vector(vec_name);
304  }
305  }
306 }

void libMesh::System::read_legacy_data ( Xdr &  io,
const bool  read_additional_data = true 
)
inherited

Reads additional data, namely vectors, for this System.

Definition at line 310 of file system_io.C.

References libMesh::System::_additional_data_written, libMesh::System::_vectors, libMesh::System::_written_var_indices, libMesh::MeshBase::active_elements_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::active_elements_end(), libMesh::Parallel::Communicator::broadcast(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::Xdr::data(), end, libMesh::System::get_mesh(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::System::n_dofs(), libMesh::System::n_vars(), libMesh::MeshBase::nodes_begin(), libMesh::MeshBase::nodes_end(), libMesh::System::number(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::Xdr::reading(), libMesh::System::solution, libMesh::sys, and libMesh::zero.

312 {
313  libmesh_deprecated();
314 
315  // This method implements the output of the vectors
316  // contained in this System object, embedded in the
317  // output of an EquationSystems<T_sys>.
318  //
319  // 10.) The global solution vector, re-ordered to be node-major
320  // (More on this later.)
321  //
322  // for each additional vector in the object
323  //
324  // 11.) The global additional vector, re-ordered to be
325  // node-major (More on this later.)
326  libmesh_assert (io.reading());
327 
328  // read and reordering buffers
329  std::vector<Number> global_vector;
330  std::vector<Number> reordered_vector;
331 
332  // 10.)
333  // Read and set the solution vector
334  {
335  if (this->processor_id() == 0)
336  io.data (global_vector);
337  this->comm().broadcast(global_vector);
338 
339  // Remember that the stored vector is node-major.
340  // We need to put it into whatever application-specific
341  // ordering we may have using the dof_map.
342  reordered_vector.resize(global_vector.size());
343 
344  //libMesh::out << "global_vector.size()=" << global_vector.size() << std::endl;
345  //libMesh::out << "this->n_dofs()=" << this->n_dofs() << std::endl;
346 
347  libmesh_assert_equal_to (global_vector.size(), this->n_dofs());
348 
349  dof_id_type cnt=0;
350 
351  const unsigned int sys = this->number();
352  const unsigned int nv = cast_int<unsigned int>
353  (this->_written_var_indices.size());
354  libmesh_assert_less_equal (nv, this->n_vars());
355 
356  for (unsigned int data_var=0; data_var<nv; data_var++)
357  {
358  const unsigned int var = _written_var_indices[data_var];
359 
360  // First reorder the nodal DOF values
361  {
362  MeshBase::node_iterator
363  it = this->get_mesh().nodes_begin(),
364  end = this->get_mesh().nodes_end();
365 
366  for (; it != end; ++it)
367  for (unsigned int index=0; index<(*it)->n_comp(sys,var); index++)
368  {
369  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to ((*it)->dof_number(sys, var, index),
370  DofObject::invalid_id);
371 
372  libmesh_assert_less (cnt, global_vector.size());
373 
374  reordered_vector[(*it)->dof_number(sys, var, index)] =
375  global_vector[cnt++];
376  }
377  }
378 
379  // Then reorder the element DOF values
380  {
381  MeshBase::element_iterator
382  it = this->get_mesh().active_elements_begin(),
383  end = this->get_mesh().active_elements_end();
384 
385  for (; it != end; ++it)
386  for (unsigned int index=0; index<(*it)->n_comp(sys,var); index++)
387  {
388  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to ((*it)->dof_number(sys, var, index),
389  DofObject::invalid_id);
390 
391  libmesh_assert_less (cnt, global_vector.size());
392 
393  reordered_vector[(*it)->dof_number(sys, var, index)] =
394  global_vector[cnt++];
395  }
396  }
397  }
398 
399  *(this->solution) = reordered_vector;
400  }
401 
402  // For each additional vector, simply go through the list.
403  // ONLY attempt to do this IF additional data was actually
404  // written to the file for this system (controlled by the
405  // _additional_data_written flag).
406  if (this->_additional_data_written)
407  {
408  std::map<std::string, NumericVector<Number>* >::iterator
409  pos = this->_vectors.begin();
410 
411  for (; pos != this->_vectors.end(); ++pos)
412  {
413  // 11.)
414  // Read the values of the vec-th additional vector.
415  // Prior do _not_ clear, but fill with zero, since the
416  // additional vectors _have_ to have the same size
417  // as the solution vector
418  std::fill (global_vector.begin(), global_vector.end(), libMesh::zero);
419 
420  if (this->processor_id() == 0)
421  io.data (global_vector);
422  this->comm().broadcast(global_vector);
423 
424  // If read_additional_data==true, then we will keep this vector, otherwise
425  // we are going to throw it away.
426  if (read_additional_data)
427  {
428  // Remember that the stored vector is node-major.
429  // We need to put it into whatever application-specific
430  // ordering we may have using the dof_map.
431  std::fill (reordered_vector.begin(),
432  reordered_vector.end(),
433  libMesh::zero);
434 
435  reordered_vector.resize(global_vector.size());
436 
437  libmesh_assert_equal_to (global_vector.size(), this->n_dofs());
438 
439  dof_id_type cnt=0;
440 
441  const unsigned int sys = this->number();
442  const unsigned int nv = cast_int<unsigned int>
443  (this->_written_var_indices.size());
444  libmesh_assert_less_equal (nv, this->n_vars());
445 
446  for (unsigned int data_var=0; data_var<nv; data_var++)
447  {
448  const unsigned int var = _written_var_indices[data_var];
449  // First reorder the nodal DOF values
450  {
451  MeshBase::node_iterator
452  it = this->get_mesh().nodes_begin(),
453  end = this->get_mesh().nodes_end();
454 
455  for (; it!=end; ++it)
456  for (unsigned int index=0; index<(*it)->n_comp(sys,var); index++)
457  {
458  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to ((*it)->dof_number(sys, var, index),
459  DofObject::invalid_id);
460 
461  libmesh_assert_less (cnt, global_vector.size());
462 
463  reordered_vector[(*it)->dof_number(sys, var, index)] =
464  global_vector[cnt++];
465  }
466  }
467 
468  // Then reorder the element DOF values
469  {
470  MeshBase::element_iterator
471  it = this->get_mesh().active_elements_begin(),
472  end = this->get_mesh().active_elements_end();
473 
474  for (; it!=end; ++it)
475  for (unsigned int index=0; index<(*it)->n_comp(sys,var); index++)
476  {
477  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to ((*it)->dof_number(sys, var, index),
478  DofObject::invalid_id);
479 
480  libmesh_assert_less (cnt, global_vector.size());
481 
482  reordered_vector[(*it)->dof_number(sys, var, index)] =
483  global_vector[cnt++];
484  }
485  }
486  }
487 
488  // use the overloaded operator=(std::vector) to assign the values
489  *(pos->second) = reordered_vector;
490  }
491  }
492  } // end if (_additional_data_written)
493 }

template<typename InValType >
void libMesh::System::read_parallel_data ( Xdr &  io,
const bool  read_additional_data 
)
inherited

Reads additional data, namely vectors, for this System. This method may safely be called on a distributed-memory mesh. This method will read an individual file for each processor in the simulation where the local solution components for that processor are stored.

This method implements the output of the vectors contained in this System object, embedded in the output of an EquationSystems<T_sys>.

9.) The global solution vector, re-ordered to be node-major (More on this later.)

for each additional vector in the object

10.) The global additional vector, re-ordered to be node-major (More on this later.)

Note that the actual IO is handled through the Xdr class (to be renamed later?) which provides a uniform interface to both the XDR (eXternal Data Representation) interface and standard ASCII output. Thus this one section of code will read XDR or ASCII files with no changes.

Definition at line 498 of file system_io.C.

References libMesh::System::_vectors, libMesh::System::_written_var_indices, libMesh::Xdr::data(), libMesh::dof_map, libMesh::FEType::family, libMesh::System::get_dof_map(), libMesh::System::get_mesh(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id, libMesh::Xdr::is_open(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::ParallelObject::n_processors(), libMesh::System::n_vars(), libMesh::System::number(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::Xdr::reading(), libMesh::SCALAR, libMesh::DofMap::SCALAR_dof_indices(), libMesh::System::solution, libMesh::Variable::type(), and libMesh::System::variable().

500 {
520  // PerfLog pl("IO Performance",false);
521  // pl.push("read_parallel_data");
522  dof_id_type total_read_size = 0;
523 
524  libmesh_assert (io.reading());
525  libmesh_assert (io.is_open());
526 
527  // build the ordered nodes and element maps.
528  // when writing/reading parallel files we need to iterate
529  // over our nodes/elements in order of increasing global id().
530  // however, this is not guaranteed to be ordering we obtain
531  // by using the node_iterators/element_iterators directly.
532  // so build a set, sorted by id(), that provides the ordering.
533  // further, for memory economy build the set but then transfer
534  // its contents to vectors, which will be sorted.
535  std::vector<const DofObject*> ordered_nodes, ordered_elements;
536  {
537  std::set<const DofObject*, CompareDofObjectsByID>
538  ordered_nodes_set (this->get_mesh().local_nodes_begin(),
539  this->get_mesh().local_nodes_end());
540 
541  ordered_nodes.insert(ordered_nodes.end(),
542  ordered_nodes_set.begin(),
543  ordered_nodes_set.end());
544  }
545  {
546  std::set<const DofObject*, CompareDofObjectsByID>
547  ordered_elements_set (this->get_mesh().local_elements_begin(),
548  this->get_mesh().local_elements_end());
549 
550  ordered_elements.insert(ordered_elements.end(),
551  ordered_elements_set.begin(),
552  ordered_elements_set.end());
553  }
554 
555  // std::vector<Number> io_buffer;
556  std::vector<InValType> io_buffer;
557 
558  // 9.)
559  //
560  // Actually read the solution components
561  // for the ith system to disk
562  io.data(io_buffer);
563 
564  total_read_size += cast_int<dof_id_type>(io_buffer.size());
565 
566  const unsigned int sys_num = this->number();
567  const unsigned int nv = cast_int<unsigned int>
568  (this->_written_var_indices.size());
569  libmesh_assert_less_equal (nv, this->n_vars());
570 
571  dof_id_type cnt=0;
572 
573  // Loop over each non-SCALAR variable and each node, and read out the value.
574  for (unsigned int data_var=0; data_var<nv; data_var++)
575  {
576  const unsigned int var = _written_var_indices[data_var];
577  if(this->variable(var).type().family != SCALAR)
578  {
579  // First read the node DOF values
580  for (std::vector<const DofObject*>::const_iterator
581  it = ordered_nodes.begin(); it != ordered_nodes.end(); ++it)
582  for (unsigned int comp=0; comp<(*it)->n_comp(sys_num, var); comp++)
583  {
584  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to ((*it)->dof_number(sys_num, var, comp),
585  DofObject::invalid_id);
586  libmesh_assert_less (cnt, io_buffer.size());
587  this->solution->set((*it)->dof_number(sys_num, var, comp), io_buffer[cnt++]);
588  }
589 
590  // Then read the element DOF values
591  for (std::vector<const DofObject*>::const_iterator
592  it = ordered_elements.begin(); it != ordered_elements.end(); ++it)
593  for (unsigned int comp=0; comp<(*it)->n_comp(sys_num, var); comp++)
594  {
595  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to ((*it)->dof_number(sys_num, var, comp),
596  DofObject::invalid_id);
597  libmesh_assert_less (cnt, io_buffer.size());
598  this->solution->set((*it)->dof_number(sys_num, var, comp), io_buffer[cnt++]);
599  }
600  }
601  }
602 
603  // Finally, read the SCALAR variables on the last processor
604  for (unsigned int data_var=0; data_var<nv; data_var++)
605  {
606  const unsigned int var = _written_var_indices[data_var];
607  if(this->variable(var).type().family == SCALAR)
608  {
609  if (this->processor_id() == (this->n_processors()-1))
610  {
611  const DofMap& dof_map = this->get_dof_map();
612  std::vector<dof_id_type> SCALAR_dofs;
613  dof_map.SCALAR_dof_indices(SCALAR_dofs, var);
614 
615  for(unsigned int i=0; i<SCALAR_dofs.size(); i++)
616  {
617  this->solution->set( SCALAR_dofs[i], io_buffer[cnt++] );
618  }
619  }
620  }
621  }
622 
623  // And we're done setting solution entries
624  this->solution->close();
625 
626  // Only read additional vectors if wanted
627  if (read_additional_data)
628  {
629  std::map<std::string, NumericVector<Number>* >::const_iterator
630  pos = _vectors.begin();
631 
632  for(; pos != this->_vectors.end(); ++pos)
633  {
634  cnt=0;
635  io_buffer.clear();
636 
637  // 10.)
638  //
639  // Actually read the additional vector components
640  // for the ith system to disk
641  io.data(io_buffer);
642 
643  total_read_size += cast_int<dof_id_type>(io_buffer.size());
644 
645  // Loop over each non-SCALAR variable and each node, and read out the value.
646  for (unsigned int data_var=0; data_var<nv; data_var++)
647  {
648  const unsigned int var = _written_var_indices[data_var];
649  if(this->variable(var).type().family != SCALAR)
650  {
651  // First read the node DOF values
652  for (std::vector<const DofObject*>::const_iterator
653  it = ordered_nodes.begin(); it != ordered_nodes.end(); ++it)
654  for (unsigned int comp=0; comp<(*it)->n_comp(sys_num, var); comp++)
655  {
656  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to ((*it)->dof_number(sys_num, var, comp),
657  DofObject::invalid_id);
658  libmesh_assert_less (cnt, io_buffer.size());
659  pos->second->set((*it)->dof_number(sys_num, var, comp), io_buffer[cnt++]);
660  }
661 
662  // Then read the element DOF values
663  for (std::vector<const DofObject*>::const_iterator
664  it = ordered_elements.begin(); it != ordered_elements.end(); ++it)
665  for (unsigned int comp=0; comp<(*it)->n_comp(sys_num, var); comp++)
666  {
667  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to ((*it)->dof_number(sys_num, var, comp),
668  DofObject::invalid_id);
669  libmesh_assert_less (cnt, io_buffer.size());
670  pos->second->set((*it)->dof_number(sys_num, var, comp), io_buffer[cnt++]);
671  }
672  }
673  }
674 
675  // Finally, read the SCALAR variables on the last processor
676  for (unsigned int data_var=0; data_var<nv; data_var++)
677  {
678  const unsigned int var = _written_var_indices[data_var];
679  if(this->variable(var).type().family == SCALAR)
680  {
681  if (this->processor_id() == (this->n_processors()-1))
682  {
683  const DofMap& dof_map = this->get_dof_map();

685  dof_map.SCALAR_dof_indices(SCALAR_dofs, var);
686 
687  for(unsigned int i=0; i<SCALAR_dofs.size(); i++)
688  {
689  pos->second->set( SCALAR_dofs[i], io_buffer[cnt++] );
690  }
691  }
692  }
693  }
694 
695  // And we're done setting entries for this variable
696  pos->second->close();
697  }
698  }

std::pair< unsigned int, Real > libMesh::ImplicitSystem::sensitivity_solve ( const ParameterVector &  parameters)
virtualinherited

Assembles & solves the linear system(s) (dR/du)*u_p = -dR/dp, for those parameters contained within parameters.

Returns a pair with the total number of linear iterations performed and the (sum of the) final residual norms

Reimplemented from libMesh::System.

Definition at line 304 of file implicit_system.C.

References libMesh::System::add_sensitivity_solution(), libMesh::System::assemble_before_solve, libMesh::ImplicitSystem::assemble_residual_derivatives(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::assembly(), libMesh::SparseMatrix< T >::close(), libMesh::DofMap::enforce_constraints_exactly(), libMesh::System::get_dof_map(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::get_linear_solve_parameters(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::get_linear_solver(), libMesh::System::get_sensitivity_rhs(), libMesh::System::get_sensitivity_solution(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::matrix, libMesh::pc, libMesh::ImplicitSystem::release_linear_solver(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::request_matrix(), libMesh::ParameterVector::size(), libMesh::LinearSolver< T >::solve(), libMesh::START_LOG(), and libMesh::STOP_LOG().

305 {
306  // Log how long the linear solve takes.
307  START_LOG("sensitivity_solve()", "ImplicitSystem");
308 
309  // The forward system should now already be solved.
310  // Now assemble the corresponding sensitivity system.
311 
312  if (this->assemble_before_solve)
313  {
314  // Build the Jacobian
315  this->assembly(false, true);
316  this->matrix->close();
317 
318  // Reset and build the RHS from the residual derivatives
319  this->assemble_residual_derivatives(parameters);
320  }
321 
322  // The sensitivity problem is linear
323  LinearSolver<Number> *linear_solver = this->get_linear_solver();
324 
325  // Our iteration counts and residuals will be sums of the individual
326  // results
327  std::pair<unsigned int, Real> solver_params =
328  this->get_linear_solve_parameters();
329  std::pair<unsigned int, Real> totalrval = std::make_pair(0,0.0);
330 
331  // Solve the linear system.
332  SparseMatrix<Number> *pc = this->request_matrix("Preconditioner");
333  for (unsigned int p=0; p != parameters.size(); ++p)
334  {
335  std::pair<unsigned int, Real> rval =
336  linear_solver->solve (*matrix, pc,
337  this->add_sensitivity_solution(p),
338  this->get_sensitivity_rhs(p),
339  solver_params.second,
340  solver_params.first);
341 
342  totalrval.first += rval.first;
343  totalrval.second += rval.second;
344  }
345 
346  // The linear solver may not have fit our constraints exactly
347 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_CONSTRAINTS
348  for (unsigned int p=0; p != parameters.size(); ++p)
349  this->get_dof_map().enforce_constraints_exactly
350  (*this, &this->get_sensitivity_solution(p),
351  /* homogeneous = */ true);
352 #endif
353 
354  this->release_linear_solver(linear_solver);
355 
356  // Stop logging the nonlinear solve
357  STOP_LOG("sensitivity_solve()", "ImplicitSystem");
358 
359  return totalrval;
360 }

void libMesh::System::set_basic_system_only ( )
inlineinherited

Sets the system to be "basic only": i.e. advanced system components such as ImplicitSystem matrices may not be initialized. This is useful for efficiency in certain utility programs that never use System::solve(). This method must be called after the System or derived class is created but before it is initialized; e.g. from within EquationSystems::read()

void libMesh::FrequencySystem::set_frequencies ( const std::vector< Real > &  frequencies,
const bool  allocate_solution_duplicates = true 
)

Set the frequency range by simply copying the values from frequencies. By default, the solution for each frequency is copied to a separate NumericVector. This feature can be disabled with allocate_solution_duplicates=false.

Definition at line 262 of file frequency_system.C.

References _finished_set_frequencies, _keep_solution_duplicates, libMesh::System::add_vector(), form_freq_param_name(), form_solu_vec_name(), libMesh::System::get_equation_systems(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::EquationSystems::parameters, libMesh::Real, libMesh::Parameters::set(), and set_current_frequency().

264 {
265  this->_keep_solution_duplicates = allocate_solution_duplicates;
266 
267  // sanity checks
268  libmesh_assert(!frequencies.empty());
269 
270  if (_finished_set_frequencies)
271  libmesh_error_msg("ERROR: frequencies already initialized.");
272 
273  EquationSystems& es =
274  this->get_equation_systems();
275 
276  // store number of frequencies as parameter
277  es.parameters.set<unsigned int>("n_frequencies") = frequencies.size();
278 
279  // set frequencies, build solution storage
280  for (unsigned int n=0; n<frequencies.size(); n++)
281  {
282  // remember frequencies as parameters
283  es.parameters.set<Real>(this->form_freq_param_name(n)) = frequencies[n];
284 
285  // build storage for solution vector, if wanted
286  if (this->_keep_solution_duplicates)
287  System::add_vector(this->form_solu_vec_name(n));
288  }
289 
290  _finished_set_frequencies = true;
291 
292  // set the current frequency
293  this->set_current_frequency(0);
294 }

void libMesh::FrequencySystem::set_frequencies_by_range ( const Real  min_freq,
const Real  max_freq,
const unsigned int  n_freq,
const bool  allocate_solution_duplicates = true 
)

Set the frequency range for which the system should be solved. n_freq frequencies are equally distributed in the interval . By default, the solution for each frequency is copied to a separate NumericVector. This feature can be disabled with allocate_solution_duplicates=false.

Definition at line 222 of file frequency_system.C.

References _finished_set_frequencies, _keep_solution_duplicates, libMesh::System::add_vector(), form_freq_param_name(), form_solu_vec_name(), libMesh::System::get_equation_systems(), libMesh::libmesh_assert_greater(), libMesh::EquationSystems::parameters, libMesh::Real, libMesh::Parameters::set(), and set_current_frequency().

226 {
227  this->_keep_solution_duplicates = allocate_solution_duplicates;
228 
229  // sanity checks
230  libmesh_assert_greater (max_freq, min_freq);
231  libmesh_assert_greater (n_freq, 0);
232 
233  if (_finished_set_frequencies)
234  libmesh_error_msg("ERROR: frequencies already initialized.");
235 
236  EquationSystems& es =
237  this->get_equation_systems();
238 
239  // store number of frequencies as parameter
240  es.parameters.set<unsigned int>("n_frequencies") = n_freq;
241 
242  // set frequencies, build solution storage
243  for (unsigned int n=0; n<n_freq; n++)
244  {
245  // remember frequencies as parameters
246  es.parameters.set<Real>(this->form_freq_param_name(n)) =
247  min_freq + n*(max_freq-min_freq)/(n_freq-1);
248 
249  // build storage for solution vector, if wanted
250  if (this->_keep_solution_duplicates)
251  System::add_vector(this->form_solu_vec_name(n));
252  }
253 
254  _finished_set_frequencies = true;
255 
256  // set the current frequency
257  this->set_current_frequency(0);
258 }

Definition: frequency_system.h:236
libMesh::FrequencySystem::set_current_frequency
void set_current_frequency(unsigned int n)
Definition: frequency_system.C:394
void libMesh::FrequencySystem::set_frequencies_by_steps ( const Real  base_freq,
const Real  freq_step = 0.,
const unsigned int  n_freq = 1,
const bool  allocate_solution_duplicates = true 
)

Set the frequency range for which the system should be solved. n_freq frequencies are created, where the lowest and highest frequencies are base_freq, and base_freq+freq_step*(n_freq-1), respectively. Calls to this of the form set_frequencies_by_steps(30.) lets this object solve the system for only this single frequency. By default, the solution for each frequency is copied to a separate NumericVector. This feature can be disabled with allocate_solution_duplicates=false.

Definition at line 186 of file frequency_system.C.

References _finished_set_frequencies, _keep_solution_duplicates, libMesh::System::add_vector(), form_freq_param_name(), form_solu_vec_name(), libMesh::System::get_equation_systems(), libMesh::EquationSystems::parameters, libMesh::Real, libMesh::Parameters::set(), and set_current_frequency().

190 {
191  this->_keep_solution_duplicates = allocate_solution_duplicates;
192 
193  // sanity check
194  if (_finished_set_frequencies)
195  libmesh_error_msg("ERROR: frequencies already initialized.");
196 
197  EquationSystems& es =
198  this->get_equation_systems();
199 
200  // store number of frequencies as parameter
201  es.parameters.set<unsigned int>("n_frequencies") = n_freq;
202 
203  for (unsigned int n=0; n<n_freq; n++)
204  {
205  // remember frequencies as parameters
206  es.parameters.set<Real>(this->form_freq_param_name(n)) =
207  base_freq + n * freq_step;
208 
209  // build storage for solution vector, if wanted
210  if (this->_keep_solution_duplicates)
211  this->add_vector(this->form_solu_vec_name(n));
212  }
213 
214  _finished_set_frequencies = true;
215 
216  // set the current frequency
217  this->set_current_frequency(0);
218 }

Definition: frequency_system.C:394
void libMesh::System::set_vector_as_adjoint ( const std::string &  vec_name,
int  qoi_num 
)
inherited

Allows one to set the QoI index controlling whether the vector identified by vec_name represents a solution from the adjoint (qoi_num >= 0) or primal (qoi_num == -1) space. This becomes significant if those spaces have differing heterogeneous Dirichlet constraints.

qoi_num == -2 can be used to indicate a vector which should not be affected by constraints during projection operations.

Definition at line 900 of file system.C.

References libMesh::System::_vector_is_adjoint.

Referenced by libMesh::System::add_adjoint_solution(), and libMesh::System::add_weighted_sensitivity_adjoint_solution().

902 {
903  // We reserve -1 for vectors which get primal constraints, -2 for
904  // vectors which get no constraints
905  libmesh_assert_greater_equal(qoi_num, -2);
906  _vector_is_adjoint[vec_name] = qoi_num;
907 }
libMesh::System::_vector_is_adjoint
std::map< std::string, int > _vector_is_adjoint
Definition: system.h:1860

void libMesh::FrequencySystem::solve ( const unsigned int  n_start,
const unsigned int  n_stop 
)

Solves the linear system for the frequencies. The solution vectors are stored in automatically allocated vectors named solution_nnnn. For access to these vectors, see System. When calling this, the frequency range should better be already set.

store the current solution in the additional vector

Definition at line 317 of file frequency_system.C.

References libMesh::LinearImplicitSystem::_final_linear_residual, _finished_assemble, _keep_solution_duplicates, libMesh::LinearImplicitSystem::_n_linear_iterations, assemble(), form_solu_vec_name(), libMesh::Parameters::get(), libMesh::System::get_equation_systems(), libMesh::System::get_vector(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::libmesh_assert_greater(), libMesh::LinearImplicitSystem::linear_solver, libMesh::ImplicitSystem::matrix, n_frequencies(), libMesh::System::name(), libMesh::EquationSystems::parameters, libMesh::Real, libMesh::ExplicitSystem::rhs, set_current_frequency(), libMesh::System::solution, solve_system, libMesh::START_LOG(), libMesh::STOP_LOG(), and vec_rval.

319 {
320  // Assemble the linear system, if not already done
321  if (!_finished_assemble)
322  this->assemble ();
323 
324  // the user-supplied solve method _has_ to be provided by the user
325  libmesh_assert(solve_system);
326 
327  // existence & range checks
328  libmesh_assert_greater (this->n_frequencies(), 0);
329  libmesh_assert_less (n_stop, this->n_frequencies());
330 
331  EquationSystems& es =
332  this->get_equation_systems();
333 
334  // Get the user-specified linear solver tolerance,
335  // the user-specified maximum # of linear solver iterations,
336  // the user-specified wave speed
337  const Real tol =
338  es.parameters.get<Real>("linear solver tolerance");
339  const unsigned int maxits =
340  es.parameters.get<unsigned int>("linear solver maximum iterations");
341 
342 
343  // // return values
344  // std::vector< std::pair<unsigned int, Real> > vec_rval;
345 
346  // start solver loop
347  for (unsigned int n=n_start; n<= n_stop; n++)
348  {
349  // set the current frequency
350  this->set_current_frequency(n);
351 
352  // Call the user-supplied pre-solve method
353  START_LOG("user_pre_solve()", "FrequencySystem");
354 
355  this->solve_system (es, this->name());
356 
357  STOP_LOG("user_pre_solve()", "FrequencySystem");
358 
359 
360  // Solve the linear system for this specific frequency
361  const std::pair<unsigned int, Real> rval =
362  linear_solver->solve (*matrix, *solution, *rhs, tol, maxits);
363 
364  _n_linear_iterations = rval.first;
365  _final_linear_residual = rval.second;
366 
367  vec_rval.push_back(rval);
368 
372  if (this->_keep_solution_duplicates)
373  this->get_vector(this->form_solu_vec_name(n)) = *solution;
374  }
375 
376  // sanity check
377  //libmesh_assert_equal_to (vec_rval.size(), (n_stop-n_start+1));
378 
379  //return vec_rval;
380 }

unsigned int libMesh::System::variable_scalar_number ( const std::string &  var,
unsigned int  component 
) const
inlineinherited
Returns
an index, starting from 0 for the first component of the first variable, and incrementing for each component of each (potentially vector-valued) variable in the system in order. For systems with only scalar-valued variables, this will be the same as variable_number(var)

Irony: currently our only non-scalar-valued variable type is SCALAR.

libMesh::System::_vectors

Definition: system.h:1848
std::pair< unsigned int, Real > libMesh::ImplicitSystem::weighted_sensitivity_adjoint_solve ( const ParameterVector &  parameters,
const ParameterVector &  weights,
const QoISet &  qoi_indices = QoISet() 
)
virtualinherited

Assembles & solves the linear system(s) (dR/du)^T*z_w = sum(w_p*(d^2q/dudp - d^2R/dudp*z)), for those parameters p contained within parameters, weighted by the values w_p found within weights.

Assumes that adjoint_solve has already calculated z for each qoi in qoi_indices.

Returns a pair with the total number of linear iterations performed and the (sum of the) final residual norms

Reimplemented from libMesh::System.

Definition at line 419 of file implicit_system.C.

References libMesh::System::add_weighted_sensitivity_adjoint_solution(), libMesh::ExplicitSystem::assemble_qoi_derivative(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::assembly(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::close(), libMesh::SparseMatrix< T >::close(), libMesh::ParameterVector::deep_copy(), libMesh::DofMap::enforce_constraints_exactly(), libMesh::System::get_adjoint_rhs(), libMesh::System::get_adjoint_solution(), libMesh::System::get_dof_map(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::get_linear_solve_parameters(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::get_linear_solver(), libMesh::SparseMatrix< T >::get_transpose(), libMesh::System::get_weighted_sensitivity_adjoint_solution(), libMesh::DofMap::has_adjoint_dirichlet_boundaries(), libMesh::QoISet::has_index(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::matrix, libMesh::System::qoi, libMesh::Real, libMesh::ImplicitSystem::release_linear_solver(), libMesh::ExplicitSystem::rhs, libMesh::LinearSolver< T >::solve(), libMesh::START_LOG(), libMesh::STOP_LOG(), libMesh::TOLERANCE, libMesh::ParameterVector::value_copy(), libMesh::SparseMatrix< T >::vector_mult_add(), and libMesh::NumericVector< T >::zero_clone().

422 {
423  // Log how long the linear solve takes.
424  START_LOG("weighted_sensitivity_adjoint_solve()", "ImplicitSystem");
425 
426  // We currently get partial derivatives via central differencing
427  const Real delta_p = TOLERANCE;
428 
429  // The forward system should now already be solved.
430  // The adjoint system should now already be solved.
431  // Now we're assembling a weighted sum of adjoint-adjoint systems:
432  //
433  // dR/du (u, sum_l(w_l*z^l)) = sum_l(w_l*(Q''_ul - R''_ul (u, z)))
434 
435  // FIXME: The derivation here does not yet take adjoint boundary
436  // conditions into account.
437  for (unsigned int i=0; i != this->qoi.size(); ++i)
438  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
439  libmesh_assert(!this->get_dof_map().has_adjoint_dirichlet_boundaries(i));
440 
441  // We'll assemble the rhs first, because the R'' term will require
442  // perturbing the jacobian
443 
444  // We'll use temporary rhs vectors, because we haven't (yet) found
445  // any good reasons why users might want to save these:
446 
447  std::vector<NumericVector<Number> *> temprhs(this->qoi.size());
448  for (unsigned int i=0; i != this->qoi.size(); ++i)
449  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
450  temprhs[i] = this->rhs->zero_clone().release();
451 
452  // We approximate the _l partial derivatives via a central
453  // differencing perturbation in the w_l direction:
454  //
455  // sum_l(w_l*v_l) ~= (v(p + dp*w_l*e_l) - v(p - dp*w_l*e_l))/(2*dp)
456 
457  // PETSc doesn't implement SGEMX, so neither does NumericVector,
458  // so we want to avoid calculating f -= R'*z. We'll thus evaluate
459  // the above equation by first adding -v(p+dp...), then multiplying
460  // the intermediate result vectors by -1, then adding -v(p-dp...),
461  // then finally dividing by 2*dp.
462 
463  ParameterVector oldparameters, parameterperturbation;
464  parameters.deep_copy(oldparameters);
465  weights.deep_copy(parameterperturbation);
466  parameterperturbation *= delta_p;
467  parameters += parameterperturbation;
468 
469  this->assembly(false, true);
470  this->matrix->close();
471 
472  // Take the discrete adjoint, so that we can calculate R_u(u,z) with
473  // a matrix-vector product of R_u and z.
474  matrix->get_transpose(*matrix);
475 
476  this->assemble_qoi_derivative(qoi_indices);
477  for (unsigned int i=0; i != this->qoi.size(); ++i)
478  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
479  {
480  this->get_adjoint_rhs(i).close();
481  *(temprhs[i]) -= this->get_adjoint_rhs(i);
482  this->matrix->vector_mult_add(*(temprhs[i]), this->get_adjoint_solution(i));
483  *(temprhs[i]) *= -1.0;
484  }
485 
486  oldparameters.value_copy(parameters);
487  parameterperturbation *= -1.0;
488  parameters += parameterperturbation;
489 
490  this->assembly(false, true);
491  this->matrix->close();
492  matrix->get_transpose(*matrix);
493 
494  this->assemble_qoi_derivative(qoi_indices);
495  for (unsigned int i=0; i != this->qoi.size(); ++i)
496  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
497  {
498  this->get_adjoint_rhs(i).close();
499  *(temprhs[i]) -= this->get_adjoint_rhs(i);
500  this->matrix->vector_mult_add(*(temprhs[i]), this->get_adjoint_solution(i));
501  *(temprhs[i]) /= (2.0*delta_p);
502  }
503 
504  // Finally, assemble the jacobian at the non-perturbed parameter
505  // values. Ignore assemble_before_solve; if we had a good
506  // non-perturbed matrix before we've already overwritten it.
507  oldparameters.value_copy(parameters);
508 
509  // if (this->assemble_before_solve)
510  {
511  // Build the Jacobian
512  this->assembly(false, true);
513  this->matrix->close();
514 
515  // Take the discrete adjoint
516  matrix->get_transpose(*matrix);
517  }
518 
519  // The weighted adjoint-adjoint problem is linear
520  LinearSolver<Number> *linear_solver = this->get_linear_solver();
521 
522  // Our iteration counts and residuals will be sums of the individual
523  // results
524  std::pair<unsigned int, Real> solver_params =
525  this->get_linear_solve_parameters();
526  std::pair<unsigned int, Real> totalrval = std::make_pair(0,0.0);
527 
528  for (unsigned int i=0; i != this->qoi.size(); ++i)
529  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
530  {
531  const std::pair<unsigned int, Real> rval =
532  linear_solver->solve (*matrix, this->add_weighted_sensitivity_adjoint_solution(i),
533  *(temprhs[i]),
534  solver_params.second,
535  solver_params.first);
536 
537  totalrval.first += rval.first;
538  totalrval.second += rval.second;
539  }
540 
541  this->release_linear_solver(linear_solver);
542 
543  for (unsigned int i=0; i != this->qoi.size(); ++i)
544  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
545  delete temprhs[i];
546 
547  // The linear solver may not have fit our constraints exactly
548 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_CONSTRAINTS
549  for (unsigned int i=0; i != this->qoi.size(); ++i)
550  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
551  this->get_dof_map().enforce_constraints_exactly
552  (*this, &this->get_weighted_sensitivity_adjoint_solution(i),
553  /* homogeneous = */ true);
554 #endif
555 
556  // Stop logging the nonlinear solve
557  STOP_LOG("weighted_sensitivity_adjoint_solve()", "ImplicitSystem");
558 
559  return totalrval;
560 }

libMesh::System::get_adjoint_rhs

Definition: system.C:1046
std::pair< unsigned int, Real > libMesh::ImplicitSystem::weighted_sensitivity_solve ( const ParameterVector &  parameters,
const ParameterVector &  weights 
)
virtualinherited

Assembles & solves the linear system(s) (dR/du)*u_w = sum(w_p*-dR/dp), for those parameters p contained within parameters weighted by the values w_p found within weights.

Returns a pair with the total number of linear iterations performed and the (sum of the) final residual norms

Reimplemented from libMesh::System.

Definition at line 565 of file implicit_system.C.

References libMesh::System::add_weighted_sensitivity_solution(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::assembly(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::clone(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::close(), libMesh::SparseMatrix< T >::close(), libMesh::ParameterVector::deep_copy(), libMesh::DofMap::enforce_constraints_exactly(), libMesh::System::get_dof_map(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::get_linear_solve_parameters(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::get_linear_solver(), libMesh::System::get_weighted_sensitivity_solution(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::matrix, libMesh::Real, libMesh::ImplicitSystem::release_linear_solver(), libMesh::ExplicitSystem::rhs, libMesh::LinearSolver< T >::solve(), libMesh::START_LOG(), libMesh::STOP_LOG(), libMesh::TOLERANCE, and libMesh::ParameterVector::value_copy().

567 {
568  // Log how long the linear solve takes.
569  START_LOG("weighted_sensitivity_solve()", "ImplicitSystem");
570 
571  // We currently get partial derivatives via central differencing
572  const Real delta_p = TOLERANCE;
573 
574  // The forward system should now already be solved.
575 
576  // Now we're assembling a weighted sum of sensitivity systems:
577  //
578  // dR/du (u, v)(sum(w_l*u'_l)) = -sum_l(w_l*R'_l (u, v)) forall v
579 
580  // We'll assemble the rhs first, because the R' term will require
581  // perturbing the system, and some applications may not be able to
582  // assemble a perturbed residual without simultaneously constructing
583  // a perturbed jacobian.
584 
585  // We approximate the _l partial derivatives via a central
586  // differencing perturbation in the w_l direction:
587  //
588  // sum_l(w_l*v_l) ~= (v(p + dp*w_l*e_l) - v(p - dp*w_l*e_l))/(2*dp)
589 
590  ParameterVector oldparameters, parameterperturbation;
591  parameters.deep_copy(oldparameters);
592  weights.deep_copy(parameterperturbation);
593  parameterperturbation *= delta_p;
594  parameters += parameterperturbation;
595 
596  this->assembly(true, false);
597  this->rhs->close();
598 
599  AutoPtr<NumericVector<Number> > temprhs = this->rhs->clone();
600 
601  oldparameters.value_copy(parameters);
602  parameterperturbation *= -1.0;
603  parameters += parameterperturbation;
604 
605  this->assembly(true, false);
606  this->rhs->close();
607 
608  *temprhs -= *(this->rhs);
609  *temprhs /= (2.0*delta_p);
610 
611  // Finally, assemble the jacobian at the non-perturbed parameter
612  // values
613  oldparameters.value_copy(parameters);
614 
615  // Build the Jacobian
616  this->assembly(false, true);
617  this->matrix->close();
618 
619  // The weighted sensitivity problem is linear
620  LinearSolver<Number> *linear_solver = this->get_linear_solver();
621 
622  std::pair<unsigned int, Real> solver_params =
623  this->get_linear_solve_parameters();
624 
625  const std::pair<unsigned int, Real> rval =
626  linear_solver->solve (*matrix, this->add_weighted_sensitivity_solution(),
627  *temprhs,
628  solver_params.second,
629  solver_params.first);
630 
631  this->release_linear_solver(linear_solver);
632 
633  // The linear solver may not have fit our constraints exactly
634 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_CONSTRAINTS
635  this->get_dof_map().enforce_constraints_exactly
636  (*this, &this->get_weighted_sensitivity_solution(),
637  /* homogeneous = */ true);
638 #endif
639 
640  // Stop logging the nonlinear solve
641  STOP_LOG("weighted_sensitivity_solve()", "ImplicitSystem");
642 
643  return rval;
644 }

Definition: implicit_system.C:1392
libMesh::ImplicitSystem::assembly

Definition: implicit_system.h:149
libMesh::DofMap::enforce_constraints_exactly
void enforce_constraints_exactly(const System &system, NumericVector< Number > *v=NULL, bool homogeneous=false) const
Definition: dof_map_constraints.C:1895
libMesh::START_LOG
START_LOG("std::sqrt()","ExactErrorEstimator")
void libMesh::System::write_header ( Xdr &  io,
const std::string &  version,
const bool  write_additional_data 
) const
inherited

Writes the basic data header for this System.

This method implements the output of a System object, embedded in the output of an EquationSystems<T_sys>. This warrants some documentation. The output of this part consists of 5 sections:

for this system

5.) The number of variables in the system (unsigned int)

for each variable in the system

6.) The name of the variable (string)

6.1.) subdomain where the variable lives

7.) Combined in an FEType:

  • The approximation order(s) of the variable (Order Enum, cast to int/s)
  • The finite element family/ies of the variable (FEFamily Enum, cast to int/s)

end variable loop

8.) The number of additional vectors (unsigned int),

for each additional vector in the system object

9.) the name of the additional vector (string)

end system

Definition at line 1269 of file system_io.C.

References libMesh::System::_vectors, libMesh::Variable::active_subdomains(), libMesh::Xdr::data(), libMesh::FEType::family, libMesh::System::get_mesh(), libMesh::FEType::inf_map, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::System::n_vars(), libMesh::System::n_vectors(), libMesh::System::name(), libMesh::FEType::order, libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::FEType::radial_family, libMesh::FEType::radial_order, libMesh::System::variable(), libMesh::System::variable_name(), libMesh::System::variable_type(), and libMesh::Xdr::writing().

1272 {
1306  libmesh_assert (io.writing());
1307 
1308 
1309  // Only write the header information
1310  // if we are processor 0.
1311  if (this->get_mesh().processor_id() != 0)
1312  return;
1313 
1314  std::string comment;
1315  char buf[80];
1316 
1317  // 5.)
1318  // Write the number of variables in the system
1319 
1320  {
1321  // set up the comment
1322  comment = "# No. of Variables in System \"";
1323  comment += this->name();
1324  comment += "\"";
1325 
1326  unsigned int nv = this->n_vars();
1327  io.data (nv, comment.c_str());
1328  }
1329 
1330 
1331  for (unsigned int var=0; var<this->n_vars(); var++)
1332  {
1333  // 6.)
1334  // Write the name of the var-th variable
1335  {
1336  // set up the comment
1337  comment = "# Name, Variable No. ";
1338  std::sprintf(buf, "%u", var);
1339  comment += buf;
1340  comment += ", System \"";
1341  comment += this->name();
1342  comment += "\"";
1343 
1344  std::string var_name = this->variable_name(var);
1345  io.data (var_name, comment.c_str());
1346  }
1347 
1348  // 6.1.) Variable subdomains
1349  {
1350  // set up the comment
1351  comment = "# Subdomains, Variable \"";
1352  std::sprintf(buf, "%s", this->variable_name(var).c_str());
1353  comment += buf;
1354  comment += "\", System \"";
1355  comment += this->name();
1356  comment += "\"";
1357 
1358  const std::set<subdomain_id_type> & domains = this->variable(var).active_subdomains();
1359  std::vector<subdomain_id_type> domain_array;
1360  domain_array.assign(domains.begin(), domains.end());
1361  io.data (domain_array, comment.c_str());
1362  }
1363 
1364  // 7.)
1365  // Write the approximation order of the var-th variable
1366  // in this system
1367  {
1368  // set up the comment
1369  comment = "# Approximation Order, Variable \"";
1370  std::sprintf(buf, "%s", this->variable_name(var).c_str());
1371  comment += buf;
1372  comment += "\", System \"";
1373  comment += this->name();
1374  comment += "\"";
1375 
1376  int order = static_cast<int>(this->variable_type(var).order);
1377  io.data (order, comment.c_str());
1378  }
1379 
1380 
1381 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_INFINITE_ELEMENTS
1382 
1383  // do the same for radial_order
1384  {
1385  comment = "# Radial Approximation Order, Variable \"";
1386  std::sprintf(buf, "%s", this->variable_name(var).c_str());
1387  comment += buf;
1388  comment += "\", System \"";
1389  comment += this->name();
1390  comment += "\"";
1391 
1392  int rad_order = static_cast<int>(this->variable_type(var).radial_order);
1393  io.data (rad_order, comment.c_str());
1394  }
1395 
1396 #endif
1397 
1398  // Write the Finite Element type of the var-th variable
1399  // in this System
1400  {
1401  // set up the comment
1402  comment = "# FE Family, Variable \"";
1403  std::sprintf(buf, "%s", this->variable_name(var).c_str());
1404  comment += buf;
1405  comment += "\", System \"";
1406  comment += this->name();
1407  comment += "\"";
1408 
1409  const FEType& type = this->variable_type(var);
1410  int fam = static_cast<int>(type.family);
1411  io.data (fam, comment.c_str());
1412 
1413 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_INFINITE_ELEMENTS
1414 
1415  comment = "# Radial FE Family, Variable \"";
1416  std::sprintf(buf, "%s", this->variable_name(var).c_str());
1417  comment += buf;
1418  comment += "\", System \"";
1419  comment += this->name();
1420  comment += "\"";
1421 
1422  int radial_fam = static_cast<int>(type.radial_family);
1423  io.data (radial_fam, comment.c_str());
1424 
1425  comment = "# Infinite Mapping Type, Variable \"";
1426  std::sprintf(buf, "%s", this->variable_name(var).c_str());
1427  comment += buf;
1428  comment += "\", System \"";
1429  comment += this->name();
1430  comment += "\"";
1431 
1432  int i_map = static_cast<int>(type.inf_map);
1433  io.data (i_map, comment.c_str());
1434 #endif
1435  }
1436  } // end of the variable loop
1437 
1438  // 8.)
1439  // Write the number of additional vectors in the System.
1440  // If write_additional_data==false, then write zero for
1441  // the number of additional vectors.
1442  {
1443  {
1444  // set up the comment
1445  comment = "# No. of Additional Vectors, System \"";
1446  comment += this->name();
1447  comment += "\"";
1448 
1449  unsigned int nvecs = write_additional_data ? this->n_vectors () : 0;
1450  io.data (nvecs, comment.c_str());
1451  }
1452 
1453  if (write_additional_data)
1454  {
1455  std::map<std::string, NumericVector<Number>* >::const_iterator
1456  vec_pos = this->_vectors.begin();
1457  unsigned int cnt=0;
1458 
1459  for (; vec_pos != this->_vectors.end(); ++vec_pos)
1460  {
1461  // 9.)
1462  // write the name of the cnt-th additional vector
1463  comment = "# Name of ";
1464  std::sprintf(buf, "%d", cnt++);
1465  comment += buf;
1466  comment += "th vector";
1467  std::string vec_name = vec_pos->first;
1468 
1469  io.data (vec_name, comment.c_str());
1470  }
1471  }
1472  }
1473 }

Definition: system.h:2132
void libMesh::System::write_parallel_data ( Xdr &  io,
const bool  write_additional_data 
) const
inherited

Writes additional data, namely vectors, for this System. This method may safely be called on a distributed-memory mesh. This method will create an individual file for each processor in the simulation where the local solution components for that processor will be stored.

This method implements the output of the vectors contained in this System object, embedded in the output of an EquationSystems<T_sys>.

9.) The global solution vector, re-ordered to be node-major (More on this later.)

for each additional vector in the object

10.) The global additional vector, re-ordered to be node-major (More on this later.)

Note that the actual IO is handled through the Xdr class (to be renamed later?) which provides a uniform interface to both the XDR (eXternal Data Representation) interface and standard ASCII output. Thus this one section of code will read XDR or ASCII files with no changes.

Definition at line 1477 of file system_io.C.

References libMesh::System::_vectors, libMesh::Xdr::data(), libMesh::dof_map, libMesh::FEType::family, libMesh::System::get_dof_map(), libMesh::System::get_mesh(), libMesh::DofObject::invalid_id, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::ParallelObject::n_processors(), libMesh::System::n_vars(), libMesh::System::name(), libMesh::System::number(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::SCALAR, libMesh::DofMap::SCALAR_dof_indices(), libMesh::System::solution, libMesh::Variable::type(), libMesh::System::variable(), and libMesh::Xdr::writing().

1479 {
1499  // PerfLog pl("IO Performance",false);
1500  // pl.push("write_parallel_data");
1501  // std::size_t total_written_size = 0;
1502 
1503  std::string comment;
1504 
1505  libmesh_assert (io.writing());
1506 
1507  std::vector<Number> io_buffer; io_buffer.reserve(this->solution->local_size());
1508 
1509  // build the ordered nodes and element maps.
1510  // when writing/reading parallel files we need to iterate
1511  // over our nodes/elements in order of increasing global id().
1512  // however, this is not guaranteed to be ordering we obtain
1513  // by using the node_iterators/element_iterators directly.
1514  // so build a set, sorted by id(), that provides the ordering.
1515  // further, for memory economy build the set but then transfer
1516  // its contents to vectors, which will be sorted.
1517  std::vector<const DofObject*> ordered_nodes, ordered_elements;
1518  {
1519  std::set<const DofObject*, CompareDofObjectsByID>
1520  ordered_nodes_set (this->get_mesh().local_nodes_begin(),
1521  this->get_mesh().local_nodes_end());
1522 
1523  ordered_nodes.insert(ordered_nodes.end(),
1524  ordered_nodes_set.begin(),
1525  ordered_nodes_set.end());
1526  }
1527  {
1528  std::set<const DofObject*, CompareDofObjectsByID>
1529  ordered_elements_set (this->get_mesh().local_elements_begin(),
1530  this->get_mesh().local_elements_end());
1531 
1532  ordered_elements.insert(ordered_elements.end(),
1533  ordered_elements_set.begin(),
1534  ordered_elements_set.end());
1535  }
1536 
1537  const unsigned int sys_num = this->number();
1538  const unsigned int nv = this->n_vars();
1539 
1540  // Loop over each non-SCALAR variable and each node, and write out the value.
1541  for (unsigned int var=0; var<nv; var++)
1542  if (this->variable(var).type().family != SCALAR)
1543  {
1544  // First write the node DOF values
1545  for (std::vector<const DofObject*>::const_iterator
1546  it = ordered_nodes.begin(); it != ordered_nodes.end(); ++it)
1547  for (unsigned int comp=0; comp<(*it)->n_comp(sys_num, var); comp++)
1548  {
1549  //libMesh::out << "(*it)->id()=" << (*it)->id() << std::endl;
1550  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to ((*it)->dof_number(sys_num, var, comp),
1551  DofObject::invalid_id);
1552 
1553  io_buffer.push_back((*this->solution)((*it)->dof_number(sys_num, var, comp)));
1554  }
1555 
1556  // Then write the element DOF values
1557  for (std::vector<const DofObject*>::const_iterator
1558  it = ordered_elements.begin(); it != ordered_elements.end(); ++it)
1559  for (unsigned int comp=0; comp<(*it)->n_comp(sys_num, var); comp++)
1560  {
1561  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to ((*it)->dof_number(sys_num, var, comp),
1562  DofObject::invalid_id);
1563 
1564  io_buffer.push_back((*this->solution)((*it)->dof_number(sys_num, var, comp)));
1565  }
1566  }
1567 
1568  // Finally, write the SCALAR data on the last processor
1569  for (unsigned int var=0; var<this->n_vars(); var++)
1570  if(this->variable(var).type().family == SCALAR)
1571  {
1572  if (this->processor_id() == (this->n_processors()-1))
1573  {
1574  const DofMap& dof_map = this->get_dof_map();
1575  std::vector<dof_id_type> SCALAR_dofs;
1576  dof_map.SCALAR_dof_indices(SCALAR_dofs, var);
1577 
1578  for(unsigned int i=0; i<SCALAR_dofs.size(); i++)
1579  {
1580  io_buffer.push_back( (*this->solution)(SCALAR_dofs[i]) );
1581  }
1582  }
1583  }
1584 
1585  // 9.)
1586  //
1587  // Actually write the reordered solution vector
1588  // for the ith system to disk
1589 
1590  // set up the comment
1591  {
1592  comment = "# System \"";
1593  comment += this->name();
1594  comment += "\" Solution Vector";
1595  }
1596 
1597  io.data (io_buffer, comment.c_str());
1598 
1599  // total_written_size += io_buffer.size();
1600 
1601  // Only write additional vectors if wanted
1602  if (write_additional_data)
1603  {
1604  std::map<std::string, NumericVector<Number>* >::const_iterator
1605  pos = _vectors.begin();
1606 
1607  for(; pos != this->_vectors.end(); ++pos)
1608  {
1609  io_buffer.clear(); io_buffer.reserve( pos->second->local_size());
1610 
1611  // Loop over each non-SCALAR variable and each node, and write out the value.
1612  for (unsigned int var=0; var<nv; var++)
1613  if(this->variable(var).type().family != SCALAR)
1614  {
1615  // First write the node DOF values
1616  for (std::vector<const DofObject*>::const_iterator
1617  it = ordered_nodes.begin(); it != ordered_nodes.end(); ++it)
1618  for (unsigned int comp=0; comp<(*it)->n_comp(sys_num, var); comp++)

1632  DofObject::invalid_id);
1633

1635  }
1636  }

1646  dof_map.SCALAR_dof_indices(SCALAR_dofs, var);
1647 
1648  for(unsigned int i=0; i<SCALAR_dofs.size(); i++)
1649  {
1650  io_buffer.push_back( (*pos->second)(SCALAR_dofs[i]) );
1651  }

1653  }
1654

dof_id_type libMesh::System::write_serialized_vectors ( Xdr &  io,
const std::vector< const NumericVector< Number > * > &  vectors 
) const
inherited

Serialize & write a number of identically distributed vectors. This method allows for optimization for the multiple vector case by only communicating the metadata once.

Definition at line 2287 of file system_io.C.

References libMesh::Xdr::data(), libMesh::FEType::family, libMesh::System::get_mesh(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::MeshBase::n_elem(), libMesh::MeshTools::n_elem(), n_nodes, libMesh::MeshBase::n_nodes(), libMesh::System::n_vars(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::SCALAR, libMesh::Variable::type(), libMesh::System::variable(), libMesh::System::write_SCALAR_dofs(), libMesh::System::write_serialized_blocked_dof_objects(), and libMesh::Xdr::writing().

2289 {
2290  parallel_object_only();
2291 
2292  libmesh_assert (io.writing());
2293 
2294  // Cache these - they are not free!
2295  const dof_id_type
2296  n_nodes = this->get_mesh().n_nodes(),
2297  n_elem = this->get_mesh().n_elem();
2298 
2299  dof_id_type written_length = 0.;
2300 
2301  if (this->processor_id() == 0)
2302  {
2303  unsigned int
2304  n_vec = cast_int<unsigned int>(vectors.size());
2305  dof_id_type
2306  vec_size = vectors.empty() ? 0 : vectors[0]->size();
2307  // Set the number of vectors
2308  io.data(n_vec, "# number of vectors");
2309  // Set the buffer size
2310  io.data(vec_size, "# vector length");
2311  }
2312 
2313  //---------------------------------
2314  // Collect the values for all nodes
2315  written_length +=
2316  this->write_serialized_blocked_dof_objects (vectors,
2317  n_nodes,
2318  this->get_mesh().local_nodes_begin(),
2319  this->get_mesh().local_nodes_end(),

2324  written_length +=
2325  this->write_serialized_blocked_dof_objects (vectors,
2326  n_elem,
2327  this->get_mesh().local_elements_begin(),
2328  this->get_mesh().local_elements_end(),
2329  io);

2332  // Finally loop over all the SCALAR variables
2333  for (unsigned int vec=0; vec<vectors.size(); vec++)
2334  for (unsigned int var=0; var<this->n_vars(); var++)
2335  if(this->variable(var).type().family == SCALAR)
2336  {
2337  libmesh_assert_not_equal_to (vectors[vec], 0);
2338 
2339  written_length +=
2340  this->write_SCALAR_dofs (*vectors[vec], var, io);
2341  }
2342 
2343  return written_length;
2344 }

void libMesh::System::zero_variable ( NumericVector< Number > &  v,

) const
inherited

Zeroes all dofs in v that correspond to variable number var_num.

Definition at line 1324 of file system.C.

1325 {
1326  /* Make sure the call makes sense. */
1327  libmesh_assert_less (var_num, this->n_vars());
1328 
1329  /* Get a reference to the mesh. */
1330  const MeshBase& mesh = this->get_mesh();
1331 
1332  /* Check which system we are. */
1333  const unsigned int sys_num = this->number();
1334 
1335  /* Loop over nodes. */
1336  {
1337  MeshBase::const_node_iterator it = mesh.local_nodes_begin();
1338  const MeshBase::const_node_iterator end_it = mesh.local_nodes_end();
1339  for ( ; it != end_it; ++it)
1340  {
1341  const Node* node = *it;
1342  unsigned int n_comp = node->n_comp(sys_num,var_num);
1343  for(unsigned int i=0; i<n_comp; i++)
1344  {
1345  const dof_id_type index = node->dof_number(sys_num,var_num,i);
1346  v.set(index,0.0);
1347  }
1348  }
1349  }
1350 
1351  /* Loop over elements. */
1352  {
1353  MeshBase::const_element_iterator it = mesh.active_local_elements_begin();
1354  const MeshBase::const_element_iterator end_it = mesh.active_local_elements_end();
1355  for ( ; it != end_it; ++it)
1356  {
1357  const Elem* elem = *it;
1358  unsigned int n_comp = elem->n_comp(sys_num,var_num);
1359  for(unsigned int i=0; i<n_comp; i++)
1360  {
1361  const dof_id_type index = elem->dof_number(sys_num,var_num,i);
1362  v.set(index,0.0);
1363  }
1364  }
1365  }
1366 }

bool libMesh::FrequencySystem::_finished_assemble
protected

true when we have finished the assemble() phase. This is the third step and requires that a) frequencies have already been set, and b) the system has been initialized.

In this linear, frequency-dependent setting, the overall system matrices mass, damping and stiffness only have to be assembled once, before multiple solutions may be obtained for different frequencies.

Definition at line 266 of file frequency_system.h.

Referenced by assemble(), clear(), and solve().

bool libMesh::FrequencySystem::_finished_init

true when we have finished the init() phase. This is the second step, and requires that frequencies have already been set.

bool libMesh::System::assemble_before_solve
inherited

Flag which tells the system to whether or not to call the user assembly function during each call to solve(). By default, every call to solve() begins with a call to the user assemble, so this flag is true. (For explicit systems, "solving" the system occurs during the assembly step, so this flag is always true for explicit systems.)

You will only want to set this to false if you need direct control over when the system is assembled, and are willing to track the state of its assembly yourself. An example of such a case is an implicit system with multiple right hand sides. In this instance, a single assembly would likely be followed with multiple calls to solve.

The frequency system and Newmark system have their own versions of this flag, called _finished_assemble, which might be able to be replaced with this more general concept.

Definition at line 1449 of file system.h.

Referenced by libMesh::ImplicitSystem::adjoint_solve(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::disable_cache(), libMesh::System::disable_cache(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::sensitivity_solve(), libMesh::CondensedEigenSystem::solve(), libMesh::EigenSystem::solve(), and libMesh::LinearImplicitSystem::solve().

AutoPtr<NumericVector<Number> > libMesh::System::current_local_solution
inherited

All the values I need to compute my contribution to the simulation at hand. Think of this as the current solution with any ghost values needed from other processors. This vector is necessarily larger than the solution vector in the case of a parallel simulation. The update() member is used to synchronize the contents of the solution and current_local_solution vectors.

Definition at line 1508 of file system.h.

Referenced by libMesh::__libmesh_petsc_snes_residual(), libMesh::UniformRefinementEstimator::_estimate_error(), libMesh::NonlinearImplicitSystem::assembly(), libMesh::EquationSystems::build_solution_vector(), libMesh::System::clear(), libMesh::Problem_Interface::computeF(), libMesh::Problem_Interface::computeJacobian(), libMesh::Problem_Interface::computePreconditioner(), libMesh::System::current_solution(), DMlibMeshFunction(), libMesh::AdjointRefinementEstimator::estimate_error(), libMesh::for(), libMesh::EquationSystems::get_solution(), libMesh::System::init_data(), libMesh::FEMContext::pre_fe_reinit(), libMesh::System::project_solution(), libMesh::System::re_update(), libMesh::System::reinit(), libMesh::System::restrict_vectors(), and libMesh::System::update().

int libMesh::System::extra_quadrature_order
inherited

A member int that can be employed to indicate increased or reduced quadrature order.

Note for FEMSystem users: By default, when calling the user-defined residual functions, the FEMSystem will first set up an appropriate FEType::default_quadrature_rule() object for performing the integration. This rule will integrate elements of order up to 2*p+1 exactly (where p is the sum of the base FEType and local p refinement levels), but if additional (or reduced) quadrature accuracy is desired then this extra_quadrature_order (default 0) will be added.

Definition at line 1481 of file system.h.

Referenced by libMesh::FEMContext::FEMContext().

AutoPtr<LinearSolver<Number> > libMesh::LinearImplicitSystem::linear_solver
inherited

The LinearSolver defines the interface used to solve the linear_implicit system. This class handles all the details of interfacing with various linear algebra packages like PETSc or LASPACK.

Real libMesh::System::time
inherited

For time-dependent problems, this is the time t at the beginning of the current timestep.

Note for DifferentiableSystem users: do not access this time during an assembly! Use the DiffContext::time value instead to get correct results.

bool libMesh::System::use_fixed_solution
inherited

A boolean to be set to true by systems using elem_fixed_solution, for optional use by e.g. stabilized methods. False by default.

Note for FEMSystem users: Warning: if this variable is set to true, it must be before init_data() is called.
